Locations: Sunnyvale, California
Program: ATLO Programs

To uphold safety for all employees, we will continue to request vaccination status for all Lockheed Martin employees including new hires. All current and newly hired employees are required to follow onsite safety measures based upon the COVID-19 Community Level at the specific work location.


This position is located in gorgeous . Lockheed Martin's ATLO Program is seeking a Python Framework Developer to automate test scripts for the organization and create a library of python APIs for test automation. This involves creating python tools for test scripting and automated integration. The candidate will need to be able to adhere to cost and schedule constraints and be familiar with python development on Linux and Windows operating systems. If this interests you and you have a passion for software engineering within the space industry then this role is for you! Apply today if you are ready to explore new opportunities and connect with a Lockheed recruiter who is excited to speak with you.

Lockheed Martin cares about their employees well-being and offers a generous benefits package: 401K, PTO, and work/life balance and more.

1. Experience using python to write scripts and utilities
2. Demonstrate ability in good coding practices by following coding standards
3. Solid understanding of python
4. Ability to obtain/maintain a Top Secret clearance; US citizenship required

1. Strong understanding of cross operating system software development
2. Direct hands on experience developing automated test scripts
3. Knowledgeable of software version control products such as Git
4. Successfully demonstrated completing tasks and delivering products on time and within budget
5. Experience in ATLO test floor execution operations

This position requires a government security clearance, you must be a US Citizen for consideration.
Top Secret

Our Radar Line of business is looking for experienced software developers that have the confidence to solve complex problems on our Agile development teams. We are looking for individuals that have a can-do attitude in a diverse and challenging environment.

The Software Engineer plans, conducts, and coordinates software development activities. Job_Description:
COVID-19 continues to significantly impact our employees, families and communities. With employee health and safety as our top priority, and as a federal contractor, Lockheed Martin is taking action to address the increased risk and uncertainty COVID-19 variants pose in the workplace and ensuring we meet our commitments to national security.

Description:At the dawn of a new age, Lockheed Martin is a pioneer, partner, innovator, and builder. Our amazing workforce is on a mission to make a difference in the world. Our World-class team leverages unique skills and experiences to create, design, and build solutions to some of the world's hardest engineering problems. Our culture encourages employees to dream big, perform with excellence and create incredible products.

At Lockheed Martin, our employees are at the core of all we do, making our people our most valuable asset. As a Software Manager in Owego, NY, your duty is to enable your teams to tackle the world's toughest problems by ensuring they have the skills, tools, and motivation for success. You will also play an important role in their career development, professional growth, and overall career satisfaction. If you have the passion, drive, and courage to dream big, then we want to build a better tomorrow with you. Come and experience your future!

The successful candidate will assume a Software Engineering First Level Management (FLM) position reporting to the Functional Manager of Rotary Wing Mission Solutions, giving functional leadership to the engineering team on the A-TEAM program. The candidate will be responsible for the technical, cost, and schedule execution of software and systems development activities. The chosen candidate will be engaged in program development activities across the full development life cycle, ensuring the appropriate standards, processes, procedures, and tools are applied. In addition, the chosen candidate will be given the opportunity to advance the craft of DevSecOps engineering, implementing new and modern tools and techniques. The successful candidate will be responsible for personnel management of a team of engineering professionals, including performance assessment, career development guidance, program assignments, merit and salary actions, training plans, staffing, and recruiting. The individual will be responsible for making innovative contributions to the development of new business opportunities and product line road maps.
Program duties include providing adequate staffing and training/skill/knowledge base; addressing Engineering Program Management (EPM) staffing requests and performance adjustments; handling contract-related issues (program priorities, work schedules, tools, workload planning, workload balance, task monitoring, issue resolution, etc.); helping put together and executing recovery plans; reviewing Earned Value Management (EVM); dealing with out-of-scope requests; participating in key milestone event preparation (PDR, CDR, etc.); keeping the team, upper management, Chief Engineer org, and Program Management informed via Items-of-Interest (IOIs), Monthly Program Reviews (MPRs), and Chief Engineer Reviews (CERs); and assuring the applicable processes are followed. Special assignments as assigned.

Some travel may be required.

The candidate must be able to obtain and maintain a security clearance at the SECRET level.

Description:Come and experience your future!

Be the best possible you!

At Lockheed Martin, we are passionate about innovation and integrity. We believe that by applying the highest standards of business ethics and forward-thinking, everything is within our capacity – and yours as a Lockheed Martin employee. Lockheed Martin values your skills, training, education, and background.

Do you want to be part of an environment that encourages and supports employees to think big, perform with quality and build incredible products? We provide the resources, reassurance, and focus - if you have the resourcefulness and courage to work hard, then we want to build a better tomorrow with you.

Define the future of aviation. Stand at the forefront of technology and innovation. Transform your ideas and dreams into reality. Join Lockheed Martin’s Flight Controls and Autonomy team and be part of the greatest transformation in aviation history; unmanned fully autonomous flight.

The Flight Controls and Autonomy team is currently seeking highly motivated technology pioneers with a desire to steer and lead the Autonomy industry. Successful candidates must be willing and able to work on highly complex complicated problems.

Leading to world-changing technological breakthroughs.

Team’s technical areas of emphasis include Fly-By-Wire Flight Control Systems, Guidance/Navigation & Control (GNC), Flight Test, Autonomy, Aviation Robotics, Perception, AI, and Motion Planning.

This position is within the Flight Controls and Autonomy Software group located in Stratford, CT. This position requires a software engineer to work as part of a modeling and software development team. The team uses a wide application of modern technical principles, theories, and concepts in the software field to develop, integrate, and test conventional and fly-by-wire flight control system software products for Sikorsky’s helicopter platforms.

The candidate will be responsible for the planning, development, integration, and verification of flight control software. The candidate will be responsible for the software efforts as part of an Integrated Product Team (IPT) in the development and maintenance of flight control system software for a variety of platforms. Candidate responsibilities will span the software development lifecycle, including planning, requirements management, detail design and implementation, integration and test, flight test, and adjudicating change requests as the software is updated, tested, and integrated. Integration activities may include a multitude of host systems, such as live aircraft, simulated systems, and laboratory environments that include constructive simulations, physical hardware, and system simulations.

The successful candidate will work with a multi-program and multi-disciplinary team and must be self-motivated with a strong work ethic, time-management, and interpersonal skills. The successful candidate must have demonstrated effective communication skills as the position will require frequent inter-organizational and potential outside customer interactions.

C/C++ programming experience is required. Cross compiler toolchain development experience is required. Working knowledge of different Avionics data buses (ARINC-429, MIL-STD-1553, IEEE 1394, Ethernet and Time-Triggered Ethernet) is required. Experience with DO-178B/C, DO-330, and DO-331 is required. The ability to work at all levels of the software lifecycle is required. Experience with MATLAB, Simulink, Stateflow and Embedded Coder is required. Development and use of Python and PERL scripting tools is required.

In addition to the responsibilities highlighted above we offer extensive benefits that include competitive 401k and insurance. We remain an equal opportunity company.

Lockheed Martin Rotary and Mission Systems in Owego, NY is seeking a full-time Early Career Software Engineer.

In this role, you will work closely with systems and software engineers to:






The successful candidate will have experience and/or knowledge of working on multidisciplinary engineering teams working together to materialize concepts, ideas, and requirements into software products for various customers.

Must be a US Citizen; this position will require a government security clearance.

Owego, New York is located about 200 miles northwest of New York City and about 75 miles south of Syracuse, New York, sits just north of the border with Pennsylvania and is part of what's known as the "Southern Tier" section of New York State. The region is home to Binghamton University, Ithaca College and Cornell University. Great metropolitan weekend getaways with friends are just a few hours away and include areas such as Niagara Falls, NYC, & Philadelphia. The Adirondacks, Catskills, Lake Ontario and the Finger Lakes are also areas to explore and host activities including: sailing, boating, kayaking, jet skiing, hiking, mountain biking, golfing, fishing, skiing, snow shoeing, concerts, shows and seasonal festivals. The local area and region are also home to several New York state wineries and craft breweries.

Description:At Lockheed Martin Rotary and Mission Systems (RMS), we are driven by innovation and integrity. We believe that by applying the highest standards of business ethics and visionary thinking, everything is within our reach – and yours as a Lockheed Martin employee. Lockheed Martin values your skills, training, and education. Come and experience your future!

This Software Engineering position will support the Future Battle Management Command and Control (FBMC2) software efforts across multiple products on the FBMC2 roadmap. The primary work location is Denver, Colorado, but Moorestown, New Jersey would be a secondary location. Ideal team members will join a team that consists of a strong DevSecOps culture, skilled engineers, and support staff with discipline and domain specific experience and training, best in industry software development practices and patterns, and cutting-edge tools for software design, development, configuration management, quality, security, and deployment.

The software engineer in this position will develop software which enables and enhances forward-deployed warfighter capabilities at the tactical edge (a.k.a., “the front lines”). This is a Software Engineering role focused on developing, modifying, testing, deploying, and maintaining applications in support of the Enterprise Technology’s FMBC2 Organization. The selected candidate will pair with program engineering teams across the business to support product maturity evolution, as well as design, develop, and release reusable components of a DevOps pipeline to be consumed by the enterprise. This position requires the ability to obtain DoD Secret Clearance (or higher), therefore U.S. Citizenship is required.

Bachelor of Degree in related field plus 2 years of professional experience or Master's Degree with no experience in Computer Science / Engineering or equivalent

Title: Python Framework Developer
Job_Description:
Job ID: 598846BR
Date posted: Jun. 06, 2022

Locations: Littleton, Colorado
Program: MSP

COVID-19 continues to significantly impact our employees, families and communities. With employee health and safety as our top priority, and as a federal contractor, Lockheed Martin is taking action to address the increased risk and uncertainty COVID variants pose in the workplace and ensuring we meet our commitments to national security.

To uphold safety for all employees, we will continue to request vaccination status for all Lockheed Martin employees including new hires. All current and newly hired employees who are unvaccinated will be required to adhere to onsite safety protocols.
Special Programs line of business has been delivering extraordinary solutions to some of our nation's most critical imperatives. Leveraging the full spectrum of capabilities across Lockheed Martin Space, the Special Programs team provides its customers a legacy of superior performance, relevance, and innovation with an unrelenting focus on Operational Excellence and Mission Success. This position will be a member of the Ground Element Integration team that integrates, tests, and deploys software and hardware products as an integral component of a larger, complex system. As a member of this team you will be responsible for coordinating the development of integration objectives, integrating products that are part of a large ground system, troubleshooting errors and working closely with System, Software and Test engineers as part of an agile-like team. You will support the integration effort into the cloud, coordinate with the test team for regression testing and perform CR (change request) checkout. This position will also help lead the future architecture roadmap for integrating, testing, and deploying future capabilities. The successful candidate will interact, plan and coordinate with multiple discipline engineering/maintenance teams to solve technical issues. You will utilize your strong organizational and communication skills to be responsible for ensuring proper standards and processes are followed. The ability to work independently with just general guidance is a must. The desire to work on a problem until it is solved is a necessity.



This position requires a government security clearance, you must be a US Citizen for consideration.
TS/SCI


By applying to this job, you are expressing interest in this position and could be considered for other career opportunities where similar skills and requirements have been identified as a match. Should this match be identified you may be contacted for this and future openings.
Medical, Dental, Vision, Life Insurance, Short-Term Disability, Long-Term Disability, 401(k) match, Flexible Spending Accounts, EAP, Education Assistance, Parental Leave, Paid time off, and Holidays.


In compliance with Colorado's Equal Pay for Equal Work Act, the annual base salary range for this position is $71,900 - $119,800 . Please note that the salary information is a general guideline only. Lockheed Martin considers factors such as (but not limited to) scope and responsibilities of the position, candidate's work experience, education/training, key skills, internal peer equity, as well as, market and business considerations when extending an offer.

This position is incentive plan eligible
Onsite Full-time: The work associated with this position will be performed onsite at a designated Lockheed Martin facility.
Lockheed Martin supports a variety of alternate work schedules that provide additional flexibility to our employees. Schedules range from standard 40 hours over a five day work week while others may be condensed. These condensed schedules provide employees with additional time away from the office and are in addition to our Paid Time off benefits.
9x80 every other Friday off

Description:This job is aligned with our 21st Century Warfare (21CWFAIA) initiative to help the U.S. and its allies leverage emerging technologies to deter threats to economic prosperity and national security.

Come and experience your future!

Be the best possible you!

At Lockheed Martin, we are passionate about innovation and integrity. We believe that by applying the highest standards of business ethics and forward-thinking, everything is within our capacity – and yours as a Lockheed Martin employee. Lockheed Martin values your skills, training, education, and background.

Do you want to be part of an environment that encourages and supports employees to think big, perform with quality and build incredible products? We provide the resources, reassurance, and focus - if you have the resourcefulness and courage to work hard, then we want to build a better tomorrow with you.

Define the future of aviation. Stand at the forefront of technology and innovation. Transform your ideas and dreams into reality. Join Lockheed Martin’s Flight Controls and Autonomy team and be part of the greatest transformation in aviation history; unmanned fully autonomous flight.

The Flight Controls and Autonomy team is currently seeking highly motivated technology pioneers with a desire to steer and lead the Autonomy industry. Successful candidates must be willing and able to work on highly complex complicated problems.

Leading to world-changing technological breakthroughs.

Team’s technical areas of emphasis include Fly-By-Wire Flight Control Systems, Guidance/Navigation & Control (GNC), Flight Test, Autonomy, Aviation Robotics, Perception, AI, and Motion Planning.

This position is within the Flight Controls and Autonomy Software group located in Stratford, CT. This position requires a software engineer to work as part of a modeling and software development team. The team uses a wide application of modern technical principles, theories, and concepts in the software field to develop, integrate, and test conventional and fly-by-wire flight control system software products for Sikorsky’s helicopter platforms.

The candidate will be responsible for the planning, development, integration, and verification of flight control software. The candidate will be responsible for the software efforts as part of an Integrated Product Team (IPT) in the development and maintenance of flight control system software for a variety of platforms. Candidate responsibilities will span the software development lifecycle, including planning, requirements management, detail design and implementation, integration and test, flight test, and adjudicating change requests as the software is updated, tested, and integrated. Integration activities may include a multitude of host systems, such as live aircraft, simulated systems, and laboratory environments that include constructive simulations, physical hardware, and system simulations.

The successful candidate will work with a multi-program and multi-disciplinary team and must be self-motivated with a strong work ethic, time-management, and interpersonal skills. The successful candidate must have demonstrated effective communication skills as the position will require frequent inter-organizational and potential outside customer interactions.

C/C++ programming experience is required. Cross compiler toolchain development experience is required. Working knowledge of different Avionics data buses (ARINC-429, MIL-STD-1553, IEEE 1394, Ethernet and Time-Triggered Ethernet) is required. Experience with DO-178B/C, DO-330, and DO-331 is required. The ability to work at all levels of the software lifecycle is required. Experience with MATLAB, Simulink, Stateflow and Embedded Coder is required. Development and use of Python and PERL scripting tools is required.

In addition to the responsibilities highlighted above we offer extensive benefits that include competitive 401k and insurance. We remain an equal opportunity company.

At Lockheed Martin Rotary and Mission Systems, Cyber & Intelligence, we are driven by innovation and integrity. We believe that by applying the highest standards of business ethics and visionary thinking, everything is within our reach – and yours as Lockheed Martin employee. Lockheed Martin values your skills, training and education. Come and experience your future!

As a software engineer, Lockheed Martin invites you to create “new realities,” enabling solutions that have never been seen before. You’ll work with fast-paced teams on diverse challenges, from creating out-of-the-box Web apps to designing software for legendary advanced projects. Whatever the project, you can rely on the backing of a global technology leader with a culture that values innovative thinking and the resources that make it happen. Stand on the shoulders of a rich heritage of achievement as you write our next chapter.

Lockheed Martin is looking for a Software Engineer to join our team in our Hanover, MD office. The Software Engineer develops, maintains, and enhances complex and diverse software systems (e.g., processing-intensive analytics, novel algorithm development, manipulation of extremely large data sets, real-time systems, and business management information systems) based upon documented requirements. Works individually or as part of a team. Reviews and tests software components for adherence to the design requirements and documents test results. Resolves software problem reports. Utilizes software development and software design methodologies appropriate to the development environment. Provides specific input to the software components of system design to include hardware/software trade-offs, software reuse, use of Commercial Off-the-shelf (COTS)/Government Off-the-shelf (GOTS) in place of new development, and requirements analysis and synthesis from system level to individual software components.

This is a technical leadership that requires superb people skills and communication skills to guide the customer as well as less-experienced developers. Looking for a collaborative problem solver who can identify gaps and ramp-up on needed skills quickly. Needs the ability to break down requirements into specific development tasks. Will assist developers in creating and dev and test scenarios for microservice applications. Work closely with other developers to provide technical approach guidance as well as assist with debugging. Skilled in (or willing to quicky learn) Kubernetes, SpringBoot, Istio, and Java.

This position offers ability to telework part-time.

Seeking an experienced Front end developer for UI/UX work with experience in React, Javascript, and Typescript.

Fourteen (14) years’ experience as a SWE in programs and contracts of similar scope, type, and complexity is required.

Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or related discipline from an accredited college or university is required. Four (4) years of additional SWE experience on projects with similar software processes may be substituted for a bachelor’s degree.

Must possess an active Security Clearance with a polygraph

508 compliance and Recoil experience are beneficial.

Experience with REST services, Java micro-services, and Kubernetes is also a plus.

Description:Lockheed Martin Aeronautics. Be More Than You Can Imagine.

The Skunk Works (Lockheed Martin Advanced Development Programs) is looking for world class talent in Software Engineering to be a part of a team that will carry on our nearly 80-year tradition making history in advanced aircraft development.

This position is with the Human Machine Interface team in Fort Worth, TX. This position requires an experienced software engineer to develop web-based solutions related to human machine interface with mission control systems. The team uses a wide application of modern technical principles, theories, and concepts in the software field to develop, integrate, and test software products to meet our customer needs. The current mission planning software in development is OmniView Web which is taking existing capabilities with desktop OmniView and moving them to a web-based solution.

Candidate responsibilities will span the technology development lifecycle, including requirements generation, system and software design and implementation, integration and operational test, and adjudicating change requests as the software is updated, tested, and integrated.

We provide the resources, encouragement and focus and if you have the passion, we want to build a better tomorrow with you!

This position is a rare opportunity… an opening on one of Lockheed Martin’s most successful programs! Come join the MARK IV-B team! We are a weather program that receives meteorological satellite data from all over the world. Our servers control the antennas, obtain and manipulate the data, then provide the images to our client product. Our client product itself provides our users with countless functionalities for our downloaded data. MARK IV-B handles everything from start to finish. We are currently looking to expand our software team and will create the perfect role for the right individual.

At the RMS Sikorsky West Palm Beach (WPB) facility we are looking for a energetic and enthusiastic software engineer to join our team of the most highly qualified personnel in the industry! Our team is working on cutting edge technology in support of future vertical lift programs. If you are interested in working on the latest advancements in rotorcraft technology, this is the team for you!

As the Flight Test Data Software Engineer you will be engaged as a Full Stack Developer creating web based applications using Java Server Faces and supporting frameworks such as Hibernate, Spring and PrimeFaces. These application will be deployed on an Apache Tomcat server and will manage data in a PostgreSQL back end database. Responsibilities will include all aspects of application development from the front end GUI through database design and implementation. Additionally you will be involved in requirements definition activities, product testing, maintenance and support.

At Lockheed Martin Rotary and Mission Systems, Cyber & Intelligence, we are driven by innovation and integrity. We believe that by applying the highest standards of business ethics and forward-thinking, everything is within our reach – and yours as Lockheed Martin employee. Lockheed Martin values your skills, training and education. Come and experience your future!

The Software Engineer develops, maintains, and enhances complex and diverse software systems (e.g., processing-intensive analytics, novel algorithm development, manipulation of very large data sets, real-time systems, and business management information systems) based upon documented requirements. Works individually or as part of a team. Reviews and tests software components for alignment to the design requirements and documents test results. Resolves software problem reports. Utilizes software development and software design methodologies appropriate to the development environment. Provides specific guidance to the software components of system design to include hardware/software trade- offs, software reuse, use of Commercial Off-the-shelf (COTS)/Government Off-the-shelf (GOTS) in place of new.

NOTE: This position requires an active Department of Defense TS/SCI W/POLY Security and US citizenship for selection.

We are seeking talented software engineers to join our team to help develop many best-in-class products and solutions in our Rotary & Mission Systems.

Join the Engineering Productivity team – we need support driving metric automation and visualization across the RMS engineering organization. We are seeking software talent that enjoys developing in a fast pace environment, working with complex data sources, and producing creative products. We need a team player that can jump right in with the right SW experience to hit the ground running and make an immediate impact. Our team develops within an agile framework and works to deliver minimum viable products (MVPs) to our internal customers that drive continuous impact and cost savings across the organization.

The Software Engineer will be responsible for developing modern web based and smart client applications to support various Engineering and advanced analytic solutions. This includes, but is not limited to, the design, development, test, maintenance and improvement of software. The successful candidate will work closely with and support other Software Engineers, Data Scientists, and Engineering subject matter experts to design and implement web applications that deliver timely and valuable business insights.

Description:At Lockheed Martin, we are passionate about innovation and integrity. We believe that by applying the highest standards of business ethics and forward-thinking, everything is within our capacity – and yours as a Lockheed Martin employee. Lockheed Martin values your skills, training, education and background.

At RMS Sikorsky we are looking for a energetic and enthusiastic software engineer to join our team of the most highly qualified personnel in the industry! Our team is working on cutting edge technology in support of future vertical lift programs. If you are interested in working on the latest advancements in rotorcraft technology, this is the team for you!

As the Flight Test Data Software Engineer you will be engaged as a Full Stack Developer creating web based applications using Java Server Faces and supporting frameworks such as Hibernate, Spring and PrimeFaces. These application will be deployed on an Apache Tomcat server and will manage data in a PostgreSQL back end database. Responsibilities will include all aspects of application development from the front end GUI through database design and implementation. Additionally you will be involved in requirements definition activities, product testing, maintenance and support.

To promote the sharing of ideas, we at Lockheed Martin champion an inclusive work environment that supports differences and big-picture thinking.

You have opportunities to play an active role in strengthening the quality of life where we live and work by volunteering more than 850,000 hours annually.

Here are some of the benefits you can enjoy:

We remain an equal opportunity company.

#fvl

Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering or a related discipline with five (5) years or more of professional experience. Candidates who have three (3) years of professional experience with a related Master’s degree will be considered in lieu of five (5) years of experience.

The ideal candidate will possess experience in a number of different programming tasks but especially web application design as well as strong RDMS skills to design and manage backend databases.

Bachelor's Degree in CIS or Computer Engineering preferred. Aerospace test and telemetry experience preferred.

Experience with the following technologies is essential:

Experience with aviation digital data bus technologies such as MIL-STD-1553, ARINC429, and IRIG-106 data formats and aircraft maintenance and configuration control is a plus.

Description:The coolest jobs on this planet… or any other… are with Lockheed Martin Space.

At the dawn of a new space age, Lockheed Martin is a pioneer, partner, innovator and builder. Our amazing people are on a mission to make a difference in the world by using our outstanding skills and experiences to create, craft and build solutions to some of the world’s most complex engineering problems. Our culture supports employees to dream big, perform with excellence and create incredible products.

About the Role
Our software engineers leverage modern languages, tools, and processes, in an environment dedicated to continuous improvement of quality, efficiency, and developer satisfaction

We pride ourselves in providing elegant, engaging, and intuitive user experiences: we design interfaces using Google’s Material Design guidelines and follow the latest web platform and web component standards in developing our user interfaces. Due to the complexity of the domain, our interfaces also often have 3D and geospatial data visualization components in Cesium.js to allow a user to quickly ingest real-time space situational awareness data. We utilize JavaScript, Lit Element, HTML, and CSS.

You will be working side by side with extraordinarily talented and experienced engineers, while having the opportunity to lead and mentor less experienced individuals on the team.

Description:Looking for a career with purpose? One that challenges your mind, grows your skills and contributes to our Nation’s most critical missions? Do you pride yourself on solving problems that others think are impossible? If you answered yes to these questions, then we would like you to join Lockheed Martin's SSC Mission Solutions, Mission Processing Team! Mission Solutions develops, delivers, and operates affordable engineering and sustainment solutions for commercial, military and intelligence users across the globe. These mission critical efforts include development of innovative enterprise, cloud and application-based solutions for mission management, command and control, collection orchestration and tasking, processing, data analysis and analytics along with premier operations and sustainment capabilities of space- based programs in support of national security.

Successful candidate will have training (BS) in a science or technology related discipline and experience in at least one of these skill or computer language areas: C, C++, C#, Python, Java, XML, Windows, .NET, and LINUX/UNIX, system software and scripting development, Java programming, web development, System analysis, System design, Software Design, Software Development and Implementation, Software Test. Candidate will join a small team on a fast-paced development effort and contribute to the success of a very challenging and rewarding mission.

Applicants selected will be subject to a government security investigation and must meet eligibility requirements for access to classified information.

Ability to obtain a TS/SCI Clearance required for this role.


Applicants selected will be subject to a government security investigation and must meet eligibility requirements for access to classified information, including US Citizenship.

Description:The coolest jobs on this planet… or any other… are with Lockheed Martin Space.

Lockheed Martin in Aurora, Colorado is in need of someone like you to join a fast paced, dynamic program in support of an important mission and customer. You’ll have the opportunity to work across the operations spectrum will utilizing software skills, project engineering skills and more.

In this role you and your teammates will certify as a satellite controller to help you understand system needs and opportunities. You’ll then use this knowledge to identify, create, and maintain user level tools to increase productivity and effectiveness across operations. The team also provides general support to flight operations which may include investigating and supporting system issues to ensure a 24/7 crew force can operate efficiently and effectively. This support could include emerging issues, engineering reviews, scheduling, procedures, training materials, evaluator duties and other direct ops support tasks.

You may have the opportunity to participate in and lead projects in support of Flight Operations. You will be required to certify in an on-console position to provide knowledge for your tasks. Once certified you can expect to periodically provide vacation relief to a 24/7 crew force.
Applicants selected will be subject to a government security investigation and meet eligibility requirements for access to classified information.

While you are training on the position you will work 24x7 Operations requiring you to work rotating shifts. This will continue after certification occasionally in support of crew vacations. Your normal schedule will be first shift (day) and a standard Monday - Friday weekday shift.

Ability to obtain TS/SCI and have an adjudicated polygraph required to start this position. The program will help you obtain those qualifications prior to start.

This is an opportunity to work in an operational environment where one can interact with other disciplines including hardware engineers, systems testers and operations crews on a program where you can have a direct impact on the mission.

Description:Lockheed Martin RMS provides mission software for the United States Strategic Command (USSTRATCOM) Nuclear Deterrence Mission. Our amazing men and women are on a mission to make a difference in the world and keep our nation safe. We use our unique skills and experiences every day to create, design and build solutions to some of the world’s hardest engineering problems.

Lockheed Martin RMS at Offutt Air Force Base in Bellevue, Nebraska is seeking a full-time Software Engineers to join our Global Strike and Product Support 2 (GSPS2) engineering team working with USSTRATCOM in an Agile / DevSecOps environment. Join us and create Web-based and Java mission systems for the Intelligence, Global Strike, and Nuclear Planning communities.

With our employees as our priority, you’ll benefit from diverse career opportunities designed to propel development and boost agility. Flexible schedules, competitive pay, and comprehensive benefits enable you to live a healthy, fulfilling life at and outside of work. Description:Engineering Project Manager (EPM) for the Integrated Common Processor (ICP) program which includes both mobile and fixed site components. Responsibilities will include development, integration, test, and certification of the assigned ICP baseline, including identification/correction of Pri 1 and Pri 2 Problem Trouble Reports (PTRs), Factory Acceptance Test Readiness Review planning and execution, Longevity Testing, and Installation Readiness Review/Approval from PMS485. Includes planning and executing installation of the assigned baseline. Required installation products include Base Electronic System Engineering Plan (BESEP) and Site Acceptance Test Plans in accordance with the Government approved Master Test and Evaluation Plan.

The EPM will be responsible for directing the Lockheed Martin team and multiple subcontractors on all aspects of the program. The EPM will be a key participant in technical and programmatic communications with the customer. The EPM will also interface with Technical Operations Engineering Managers to ensure program needs are being staffed and schedules and budgets are accurately being performed against and managed.

Responsibilities include cost, technical, and schedule performance of both LM and partners/subcontractors/vendors. Additional responsibilities includes working with LM Chief Engineer and Program Management to identify and address technical and programmatic issues and supporting proposal efforts within the business area. Project status will be developed and presented in accordance with LM and PMS485 customer business rhythm.

Work will be performed in Manassas, VA.

Security clearance is required.










Final Secret Security clearance is required

Description:The coolest jobs on this planet… or any other… are with Lockheed Martin Space.

At the dawn of a new space age, Lockheed Martin is a pioneer, partner, innovator and builder. Our amazing people are on a mission to make a difference in the world and every day we use our unique skills and experiences to create, design and build solutions to some of the worlds’ hardest engineering problems. Our culture encourages employees to dream big, perform with excellence and create incredible products. We provide the resources, inspiration and focus and if you have the passion and courage to dream big, we want to build a better tomorrow with you.

Going to space is just the beginning. It’s what you do when you get there that matters. Lockheed Martin builds the satellites and spacecraft that do amazing things in space for government and commercial customers. Connecting people. Advancing discovery. And protecting what matters most. Lockheed Martin-built satellites give earlier warning of severe weather, connect troops on the battlefield, and deliver GPS directions to a billion people worldwide.

As we look to the future, we’re driving innovations to help our customers do even more in orbit. That’s why we’re crafting smarter satellites that operate like smartphones in the sky, with apps that can be updated in orbit so they can adapt as mission needs on the ground change. Your mission is ours. And as that mission evolves, we’ll be ready. Will you?

What does this role look like?

Did you ever think that you could work for a company and actually have an impact on programs that are working on putting astronauts on Mars, creating 3D printed satellites, launching payloads that learn in orbit, or that are developing national defense systems? Lockheed Martin Space technology connects millions of people around the world and we’re accelerating tomorrow’s breakthroughs to help our customers stay ahead in an ever-changing world. We’re shaping the space technologies of tomorrow, today. At Space, we are driven by innovation and integrity. We believe that by applying the highest standards of business ethics and visionary thinking, everything is within our reach – and yours as a Lockheed Martin Space employee. At Space we value your skills, training, and education. Come, join us and experience your future!

This role will offer you the following daily challenges:

Position will report to FBM Information Systems (IS) Infrastructure Sr. Manager. Responsibilities will include:

Description:The F-35 Training and Logistics Market Segment, Development and Modernization, Development Foundations 3 (DFC3) Program Manager is responsible for cost, schedule, and technical performance supporting lab infrastructure, upgrades, and reliability necessary to support continued training development vital to maintaining air system alignment and enhancing the F-35 Training and Logistics Market Segment. The DFC3 Program Manager will act as a primary customer and supplier interface (Aeronautics, JPO, and Vendors) throughout training development and modernization execution. In this role the Program Manager will be overseeing day-to-day program execution of lab infrastructure, working with RMS Supply Chain Management, Engineering Program Managers, Functional Managers and Executive Leadership to ensure development lab availability / sustainment. Also included in the Program Management responsibilities will be the development/incorporation of new security baselines across the F-35 Pilot and Maintenance Training products and ensuring timely receipt of ATOs. The DFC3 Program Manager will manage the staffing demand, risks and opportunities, process improvement initiatives, and make decisions based on execution metrics. The role includes shaping the F-35 Training modernization portfolio to ensure cost reductions continue to be driven into the business and a focus on reducing deployment timelines of new products across the Enterprise.


Previous LM experience

Description:1. Prepares bid packages, conducts bidders' conferences, develops evaluation criteria, analyzes and evaluates proposals, negotiates subcontract provisions including price, selects or recommends subcontractors, writes subcontract packages, prepares awards and administers resulting subcontracts and required change activity.

1. Experience in Procurement / Subcontract Management, with Production and/or Development Programs

18. Strong communication skills: phone and e-mail.

1. Position requires coordination of program requirements across all supplier life-cycle stages.

Description:

Lockheed Martin Aeronautics. Be More Than You Can Imagine.

Mods & Upgrades Program Manager responsible for execution of contract scope from contract award through contract closeout. Requires coordination and integration across multiple teams to provide the required guidance and allocations and translating those from the Fleet configuration plan to authorized programs.

May participate in the negotiation of proposals and contract changes. For existing contracts, coordinates the monthly reporting to Aero and Corporate. Selected candidate would be responsible for monthly financial deliverables as well as approval of Budget Change Requests (BCR) and EAC Change Requests (ECR).

Establishes milestones and monitors adherence to master plans and schedules, identifies program problems and obtains solutions, such as allocation of resources or changing contractual specifications. Prepares and presents product information to customers. Selected candidate will be responsible to assist in resolution of high-level, program-wide technical, programmatic, business, and contracting issues that can affect the basic configuration of the F-35 weapon system, establish or alter a fundamental ground rule for some aspect of a production or sustainment contract, or determine the work content or execution procedure in one of the current or planned Sustainment contracts. Task assignments will arise from various sources, and the output from the projects worked by this individual will often include coordination with, and out briefs for, executive leaders. Candidate will coordinate with various functions on the team to develop integrated technical/project solutions to both tactical and strategic program issues.

Description:Lockheed Martin is seeking a Development Program Manager to provide programmatic leadership.

The Upper Tier Integrated and Air Missile Defense (UTIAMD) THAAD Development Program Area is responsible for the execution of THAAD Weapon System and Component design, development, integration and test inclusive of expanded UTIAMD developments, follow-on and R&D efforts for UTIAMD Programs. Development efforts include, but are not limited to, development of future Weapon System capabilities, incremental product changes, hardware redesigns and changes due to obsolescence, increased performance capability, cost reduction initiatives, technology insertion, and changes in response to an expanded target space.

This position will be responsible for managing the execution of all THAAD Seeker Development work performed by a major subcontractor. This position requires solid two-way communications with the Global Supply Chain for management of suppliers, and finance, planning, contracts, quality, engineering and requires continuous communications with the UTIAMD THAAD Interceptor Transition to Production and Production Directors to ensure overall UTIAMD Interceptor objectives are achieved across the program life cycle.

This position requires establishing professional relationships with leadership at a major subcontractor including a frequent onsite presence in Nashua, NH.

Experience with interceptor/missile hardware/software development.

Leadership experience running large development teams.

Demonstrated program management or subcontract management experience; experience working with supply chain management to ensure product meets quality, cost and schedule requirements.

Demonstrated Earned Value Management (EVM) experience with direct experience with Integrated Master Schedules.

Risk and Opportunity Management experience.

DOD Secret Clearance.

Bachelor's degree in Engineering

Experience with interceptor/missile hardware/software development.

Description:The selected candidate will be assigned to a Lean Agile Center of Excellence (LACE) Hub and Spoke model housed within the Systems Engineering competency. This role will work across multiple functions and disciplines while engaging directly with Agile teams that are using Scrum, Kanban and a Common Agile Framework developed within Lockheed Martin. The candidate will promote the Agile mindset and act as an effective change agent for Agile teams. Work with a team of Agile Coaches, ensuring alignment regarding mindset and frameworks are in place and in support of the Enterprise Agility vision and roadmap. The candidate will also mentor level 2 Agile Coaches across all functions of the organization.
The candidate will work with Lines of Business Integrators within each program to establish standard processes for Agile Development Practices and integration with the overarching Systems Engineering (SE) Process and Program-level Systems Engineering Master Plans. Ensure integration of the Agile and SE Processes with E&T Teams and with customer program offices. The candidate will assist in implementing transformation drivers, goals, priorities and metrics with internal stakeholders and the Agile Coaching team. The role will demonstrate the ability to analyze the state of the Agile teams within the responsible areas to determine Scrum Master resourcing needs and opportunities for relentless improvements of Agile practices. Establish Agile role-based training plan & material. Develop and provide standard policies, training, and coaching for Agile implementation across the Line of Business. Act as a Reflective Observer, Facilitator, Mentor, Coach, Hands-on Expert and Counselor to LM Teams. Immediate assignments will be given which contributes to the development Agile data collection methodology, Repository of Backlog, Reference Implementation Artifacts needed to maintain Configuration Management, achieve Airworthiness Certification, and to satisfy Program System Engineering Master Plans and customer requirements.

Description:Description: Lockheed Martin is seeking a Cybersecurity Analyst for the Command and Control Battle Management Communications (C2BMC) program.

The successful candidate will have a working knowledge of System Security controls for the Assessment of Mission systems. This position will be actively involved in the C2BMC Cybersecurity Remediation (CCR) initiative and provide ongoing analysis of Nessus vulnerability & compliance scans.

The candidate will be expected to communicate and work closely with process and system owners, information technology management, Cyber peers, Program Office technical/management staff and other C2BMC Agile Release Trains (ARTs) to enhance the overall Cyber posture of the system.

The majority of the A&A work will include handling technical documentation, assessing known vulnerabilities, engineering responses for system POA&Ms, conducting risk analysis for Risk Acceptance Requests (RARs) and providing Cyber Engineering support for C2BMC program and Customer meetings.

The position will also include assisting with creating and maintaining RMF packages in eMASS and other Agile Product team assigned tasks as necessary.

Description:The coolest jobs on this planet… or any other… are with Lockheed Martin Space

At the dawn of a new space age, Lockheed Martin is a pioneer, partner, innovator and builder. Our amazing people are on a mission to make a difference in the world and every day we use our unique skills and experiences to create, design and build solutions to some of the worlds’ hardest engineering problems. Our culture encourages employees to dream big, perform with excellence and create incredible products. We provide the resources, inspiration and focus and if you have the passion and courage to dream big, we want to build a better tomorrow with you.

Going to space is just the beginning. It’s what you do when you get there that matters. Lockheed Martin builds the satellites and spacecraft that do amazing things in space for government and commercial customers. Connecting people. Advancing discovery. And protecting what matters most. Lockheed Martin-built satellites give earlier warning of severe weather, connect troops on the battlefield, and deliver GPS directions to a billion people worldwide.

As we look to the future, we’re driving innovations to help our customers do even more in orbit. That’s why we’re crafting smarter satellites that operate like smartphones in the sky, with apps that can be updated in orbit so they can adapt as mission needs on the ground change. Your mission is ours. And as that mission evolves, we’ll be ready. Will you?




Lockheed Martin Space in Littleton, CO has an immediate opportunity for a Supply Chain Management (SCM) Regulatory Compliance Analyst who wants to be part of this mission. If you have an interest in all things space and an interest in working for a company that will put astronauts on Mars, create 3D printed satellites, launch payloads that learn in orbit, or that develop national defense systems, come and be a part of our Compliance team. At Lockheed Martin Space, we are driven by innovation and integrity. We believe that by applying the highest standards of business ethics and visionary thinking, everything is within our reach – and yours - as a Lockheed Martin employee. Lockheed Martin values your Supply Chain skills, training, and education. Come and experience your future!


Reporting to the Manager of SCM Compliance, you will be part of a team that supports critical Government and non-government programs, ensuring the integrity of the acquisition process including compliance with company policies and procedures and compliance with the Federal Acquisition Regulations and supplements thereto.


















Our employees play an active role in strengthening the quality of life where we live and work by volunteering more than 850,000 hours annually.








We are creating a better today and tomorrow by seamlessly aligning diversity and inclusion efforts with Lockheed Martin’s values and business strategy. We offer business resource groups such as African American Council for Excellence (AACE), The Women’s Impact Network (WIN), Hispanic Organization for Leadership & Awareness (HOLA), Military/Veterans Network, PRIDE LGBT Professional Network, and more. We are also committed to enabling transitioning veterans to connect with their communities and find new purpose as they reintegrate into civilian life. By clicking on the links, you can find out more on how we proudly support Global Diversity and Hiring Our Heroes

At Space we value your skills, training, and education. We believe that by applying the highest standards of business ethics and visionary thinking, everything is within our reach – and yours as a Lockheed Martin Space employee… join us to experience your future!

Description:Our products play an important role in the national security of the United States and more than 70 other countries, ensuring peace and stability around the world. Highly trained and specialized personnel and facilities are key to the company's unrivaled success in the aeronautics industry. Our workforce of more than 25,000 has pre-eminent expertise in advanced aircraft design and production, modification and support, stealth technology and systems integration and information technology.

Join the Lockheed Martin Aeronautics Field Sustainment (AFS) team as Senior at our Edwards Air Force, California facility! In this position, you will be responsible for implementing and administering the LM Aeronautics Property Management system for the Operational Test & Evaluation (OT&E) F-35 Program.

This position will create Property Management processes and procedures, physically identify assets with an asset number, create property records, conduct periodic inventories, submit required property reports, and conduct self-assessments. Other responsibilities include:


aeroafs

The following Basic Qualifications are skills that a candidate must possess to be considered for this position:

1. Experience managing Government and Contractor acquired property in accordance with company policies and Federal Acquisition Regulation (FAR) and Defense Federal Acquisition Regulation (DFAR) regulations applicable to property management (e.g., FAR 52.245-1, DFAR 252.211.7007, etc.).
2. At least 5 years Property Management experience.
3. Experience reading and interpreting Contract Line Item Number (CLIN) verbiage on import/export property management covering both US and Foreign Partners.
4. Experience coordinating with Item Managers, Supply Service Providers, and Maintenance Logistics Support Manager on logistics issues.
5. Experience with such processes as acquisition, identification, movement, reports, inventory, utilization and disposition of property material.
6. Experience with government supply management and property accounting systems.
7. Experience with FAR, DFAR, Plant Clearance Automated Reutilization Screening System (PCARSS) and Lost Theft, Damage and Destruction (LTDD) Programs and processes.
8. Experience in processing Return Material Authorization (RMA) through Autonomic Logistics Information System (ALIS) and knowledgeable in processing shipments of repairable assets to Source of Repair (SOR) and/or local disposal.
9. Experience with Customer Relationship Management (CRM) and Action Requests (ARs) initiation through to resolution including coordination efforts with various subject matter experts within Lockheed Martin.
10. Experience with Autonomic Logistics Information System (ALIS).
11. Experience with LM Property Accountability System (MAXIMO).
12. Experience with Excel, Word and Outlook

The following Desired Skills are not required but are those skills that would set a candidate apart from other candidates:

1. Experience with Fifth Generation Aircraft Supply Chain and Property Management Systems.
2. Considerable experience with Microsoft Office.
3. Capable of rapidly assimilating and utilizing multiple versions of asset controlling software and programs.
4. Possess an ability to work in a diverse/integrated work environment.
5. Possess the ability to perform periodic inspections and inventories.
6. Self-starter, with ability to build and maintain positive work relationships.

Title: Information Technology Professionals - Online Event Nov 17
Job_Description:
What You Will Do

This position will be filled at either the Quality Assurance Analyst 2 or 3 level, depending on the skills of the selected candidate. Additional job responsibilities (outlined below) will be assigned if the candidate is hired at the higher level.

Come join one of the most exciting projects at LANL in recent memory and a chance for a new weapon to be introduced into the stockpile! Q-20 is seeking outstanding, organized, motivated, and self-starting individuals to provide support to the rapid growing W93/Mk7 program and team. This is the opportunity to be part of the first new weapon system program in over 30 years! Q-20 as it sits today is a small group that will grow with the success of the program. Q-20, W93/Mk7 Systems Development and Realization Group, defines, develops, and fields the warhead system for the newest Navy sub-launched ballistic missile weapon program. We support the DoD/Navy SSP and DoE/NNSA customers in defining the mission need and corresponding technical and programmatic requirements. The W93 collaborates closely with Sandia National Laboratory and Lockheed Martin Systems design agencies; developing the re-entry system, ensuring safe, secure, & reliable warhead performance and a relevant nuclear deterrent. Q-20 also incorporates the production agency teams (KCNSC, Pantex, SRS, Y-12, LANL, and SNL) tightly into the design, qualification, and realization processes.

The successful candidate will support internal and external communications on the W93 program. Candidate will coordinate major internal and general external meetings: scheduling facilities, managing agendas, capturing and following action items. Also, ensure timely and coordinated communications: maintain list of document/presentation deadlines, process approvals of documents for external release, manages methods for external distribution. Act as eyes and ears for the program: support a range of program meetings, capture and follow major program actions, be empowered to identify systematic issues on the program.









Demonstrated experience supporting customers with programmatic planning. Demonstrated skill with both excellent written and oral communication. Demonstrated behavior utilizing tact, diplomacy, discretion, and attention to detail. Working knowledge in developing and nurturing effective working relationships with internal and external customers.



Ability to organize, prioritize, and take initiative and ownership of multiple and conflicting issues in a manner that fosters institutional values and customer satisfaction. Demonstrated ability to interact effectively with a variety of organizations. Demonstrated ability to calmly manage interruptions and changing priorities; to complete assignments with or without established procedures; and be available and dependable.



Experience effectively collaborating with organizations to identify areas of improvement, ability to ensure task completion, leads and experience in building strong customer relations, consensus with team building, and delegation of authorities. Demonstrated ability to work effectively as part of a team in a multi-discipline environment.



In addition to what was outlined at the lower level, at this level a Quality Assurance Analyst will need:



Leads and/or participates in internal and external meetings, product realization teams, and reviews. Responsible for independent actions, decision-making, and accountable within area of responsibility, managing multiple tasks with minimal supervision. Ability to coordinate activities such as logistics for daily and/or high-level meetings, maintaining calendars, scheduling and supporting VTCs, generating agendas, capturing and closing out action items to completion.



Experience in designing, developing, and implementing supporting tools such as a tracking system to capture and manage multi-organizational action items. Advanced experience with configuration management and quality control pertaining to, data gathering and process improvement activities.



Experience in mentoring others at equivalent or lower level. Experience interacting within a large team, with technical staff, and supporting customers from diverse backgrounds to ensure high-quality service. Utilization of tact, diplomacy and discretion in dealing with sensitive and confidential information.

The Quality Assurance Analyst 2 position requires a Bachelor's Degree and 5 years of related experience; or, an equivalent combination of education and experience directly related to the occupation.

The Quality Assurance Analyst 3 position requires a Bachelor's Degree and 8 years of related experience; or, an equivalent combination of education and experience directly related to the occupation. At this level, post graduate course work may be desirable.

This position will be located in Los Alamos, NM.



The COVID vaccine is mandatory for all Laboratory employees, on-site contractors, and on-site subcontractors unless granted an accommodation under applicable state or federal law. This requirement will apply to those working on-site, those teleworking, and all new hires.

Regular appointment employees are required to serve a period of continuous service in their current position in order to be eligible to apply for posted jobs throughout the Laboratory. If an employee has not served the time required, they may only apply for Laboratory jobs with the documented approval of their Division Leader. The position commitment for this position is 1 year.



This is a full-time onsite position and some travel may be required.



Please attach a copy of your resume & cover letter addressing how you meet the minimum / desired qualifications.


Located in beautiful northern New Mexico, Los Alamos National Laboratory (LANL) is a multidisciplinary research institution engaged in strategic science on behalf of national security. Our generous benefits package includes:

§ PPO or High Deductible medical insurance with the same large nationwide network

§ Dental and vision insurance

§ Free basic life and disability insurance

§ Paid childbirth and parental leave

§ Award-winning 401(k) (6% matching plus 3.5% annually)

§ Learning opportunities and tuition assistance

§ Flexible schedules and time off (paid sick, vacation, and holidays)

§ Onsite gyms and wellness programs

§ Extensive relocation packages (outside a 50 mile radius)


- Employment with Triad requires a favorable decision by NNSA indicating employee is suitable under NNSA Supplemental Directive 206.2. Please note that this requirement applies only to citizens of the United States. Foreign nationals are subject to a similar requirement under DOE Order 142.3A.

(Position will be cleared to this level). Applicants selected will be subject to a Federal background investigation and must meet eligibility requirements* for access to classified matter. This position requires a Q clearance which requires US Citizenship except in extremely rare circumstances. Dependent upon position, additional authorization to access nuclear weapons information may be required that may or may not be available to dual citizens depending upon the circumstances.


This position is subject to the requirements of the DOE Human Reliability Program as specified in 10 Code of Federal Regulation, Part 712, §712.11. These requirements include on going drug and alcohol testing, as well as periodic medical and psychological evaluations.

This position is subject to DOE Order 426.2, Personnel Selection, Training, and Qualification Requirements for DOE Nuclear Facilities, which establishes entry-level requirements to ensure candidates selected for specific positions can successfully perform the requirements of the job.

The Laboratory requires successful applicants to complete a new-employment drug test and maintains a substance abuse policy that includes random drug testing. Although New Mexico and other states have legalized the use of marijuana, use and possession of marijuana remain illegal under federal law. A positive drug test for marijuana will result in termination of employment, even if the use was pre-offer.

Term status Laboratory employees applying for regular-status positions are converted to regular status.

Regular appointment employees who have served the required period of continuous service in their current position are eligible to apply for posted jobs throughout the Laboratory. If an employee has not served the required period of continuous service, they may only apply for Laboratory jobs with the documented approval of their Division Leader. Please refer to Policy Policy P701 for applicant eligibility requirements.
Los Alamos National Laboratory is an equal opportunity employer and supports a diverse and inclusive workforce. All employment practices are based on qualification and merit, without regard to race, color, national origin, ancestry, religion, age, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation or preference, marital status or spousal affiliation, physical or mental disability, medical conditions, pregnancy, status as a protected veteran, genetic information, or citizenship within the limits imposed by federal laws and regulations. The Laboratory is also committed to making our workplace accessible to individuals with disabilities and will provide reasonable accommodations, upon request, for individuals to participate in the application and hiring process. To request such an accommodation, please send an email to applyhelp@lanl.gov or call 1-505-665-4444 option 1.Employment StatusFull Time

Description:At Lockheed Martin, we believe that by applying the highest standards of business ethics and forward-thinking, everything is within our reach – and yours as a Lockheed Martin employee. We value your unique skills and expertise, and we aim to give back continuously by offering a wide variety of benefits and amenities to help our employees live flexible, balanced, and fulfilling lives at, and outside of, work.

Lockheed Martin Rotary and Mission Systems has an opportunity in Owego, NY for an early career Systems Safety Engineer supporting the Specialty Engineering team of Enterprise Technology. As an early career hire on our Systems Engineering team, you can help us take on the world’s most important and complex challenges by providing solutions to a variety of technical problems of moderate scope and complexity. In this important role, you will collaborate with a diverse team of technical professionals and interact with outside customers. The successful candidate will be flexible, motivated, dedicated, detail-focused, team-oriented, and capable of multi-tasking.

The engineer will join a group of experienced safety and specialty engineers working on various aircraft and electronic warfare platforms. You will lead analysis and design support efforts for all aspects of the system safety programs on these products, ensuring that safety is crafted into the hardware and software of these products.

The engineer will also work on tasking which will include requirements analysis, interface analysis, and operations analysis, as well as system safety test and verification. The engineer will have the opportunity to grow skills and understanding of System Safety Engineering, improve and evolve the System Safety process and methodology, and be an ambassador of the discipline within the company. The engineer will work directly with customers and project leadership to report out on safety program status, and will be responsible for preparing reports, and reviewing subcontractor safety documentation and analyses.

Owego, New York is located about 200 miles northwest of New York City and about 75 miles south of Syracuse, New York, sits just north of the border with Pennsylvania and is part of what's known as the "Southern Tier" section of New York State. The region is home to Binghamton University, Ithaca College and Cornell University. Great metropolitan weekend getaways with friends are just a few hours away and include areas such as Niagara Falls, NYC, & Philadelphia. The Adirondacks, Catskills, Lake Ontario and the Finger Lakes are also areas to explore and host activities including: sailing, boating, kayaking, jet skiing, hiking, mountain biking, golfing, fishing, skiing, snow shoeing, concerts, shows and seasonal festivals. The local area and region are also home to several New York state wineries and craft breweries.

Come join the Lockheed Martin Space RF & Radar Payload Center of Excellence and shape the future! You can work on challenging programs in support of Space Vehicles, Hypersonics, Missile Defense and more.



As a you will develop and evaluate radar systems payloads and architectures for missions related to but not limited to Electronic Warfare (EW), Ground Moving Target Indication (GMTI), Airborne Moving Target Indication (AMTI), and Synthetic-aperture radar (SAR). The job role requires in depth understanding of RF systems, radar signal processing and their relation to payload and the operational architectures and constraints.

Daily activities will include mission analysis, developing algorithms for advanced radar applications, analysis software development, interfacing with HW and processor engineers, and HWIL planning and testing and support program acquisition in all phases of the design.

Description:At the dawn of a new age, Lockheed Martin is a pioneer, partner, innovator, and builder. Our amazing workforce is on a mission to make a difference in the world. Our World-class team leverages unique skills and experiences to create, design, and build solutions to some of the world's hardest engineering problems. Our culture encourages employees to dream big, perform with excellence and create incredible products.

At Lockheed Martin, our employees are at the core of all we do, making our people our most valuable asset. As a Software Manager in Owego, NY, your duty is to enable your teams to tackle the world's toughest problems by ensuring they have the skills, tools, and motivation for success. You will also play an important role in their career development, professional growth, and overall career satisfaction. If you have the passion, drive, and courage to dream big, then we want to build a better tomorrow with you. Come and experience your future!

The successful candidate will assume a Systems Engineering First Level Management (FLM) position reporting to the Functional Manager of Rotary Wing Mission Solutions, giving functional leadership to the engineering team on the A-TEAM program. The candidate will be responsible for the technical, cost, and schedule execution of software and systems development activities. The chosen candidate will be engaged in program development activities across the full development life cycle, ensuring the appropriate standards, processes, procedures, and tools are applied. In addition, the chosen candidate will be given the opportunity to advance the craft of DevSecOps engineering, implementing new and modern tools and techniques. The successful candidate will be responsible for personnel management of a team of engineering professionals, including performance assessment, career development guidance, program assignments, merit and salary actions, training plans, staffing, and recruiting. The individual will be responsible for making innovative contributions to the development of new business opportunities and product line road maps.
Program duties include providing adequate staffing and training/skill/knowledge base; addressing Engineering Program Management (EPM) staffing requests and performance adjustments; handling contract-related issues (program priorities, work schedules, tools, workload planning, workload balance, task monitoring, issue resolution, etc.); helping put together and executing recovery plans; reviewing Earned Value Management (EVM); dealing with out-of-scope requests; participating in key milestone event preparation (PDR, CDR, etc.); keeping the team, upper management, Chief Engineer org, and Program Management informed via Items-of-Interest (IOIs), Monthly Program Reviews (MPRs), and Chief Engineer Reviews (CERs); and assuring the applicable processes are followed. Special assignments as assigned.

Some travel may be required.

The candidate must be able to obtain and maintain a security clearance at the SECRET level.

Lockheed Martin is looking for a Systems Engineer to join our team in our Annapolis Junction, MD office. They Systems Engineer analyzes user’s requirements, concept of operations documents, and high-level system architectures to develop system requirements specifications. Analyzes system requirements and leads design and development activities. Guides users in formulating requirements, advises alternative approaches, and conducts feasibility studies. Provides technical leadership for the integration of requirements, design, and technology. Incorporates new plans, designs and systems into ongoing operations. Develops user documentation. Develops system Architecture and system design documentation. Guides system development and implementation planning through assessment or preparation of system engineering management plans and system integration and test plans. Interacts with the Government regarding Systems Engineering technical considerations and for associated problems, issues or conflicts. Ultimate responsibility for the technical integrity of work performed and results associated with the Systems Engineering area of responsibility. Communicates with other program personnel, government overseers, and senior executives.

functional oversight to include: multi-element integration, test planning and development, test coordination and execution, model-based system design and test, requirements analysis and verification, and test procedure development.
