Title: Principal Software Engineer (Python)
Job_Description:
Company
Berkshire Grey is the industry leader in Intelligent Enterprise Robotics, we develop AI-enabled robotics that transform the way our customers thrive, compete and win. Our company includes a team of world class technology experts recruited from centers of excellence including iRobot, Google, Amazon, Kiva Systems, Carnegie Mellon, MIT, Cornell, University of Pennsylvania, Rethink Robotics, Lockheed Martin, BAE, Honeywell, and others. Prior work by this team resulted in more than 30 commercial products and billions of dollars in product revenue. Simply put, our team knows how to produce disruptive products that generate value for our customers. Through our leading-edge technology, we can automate tasks that have never been performed by machines and to do so at a price/performance level that brings our customers to us.
As a company, we work hard and are creating material impact with our customers. Our culture is highly collaborative and open, the technical problems are challenging, the business opportunities are magnificent, and the value your work brings to customers and to the world is clear. Indeed, what could be better?

Title: Principal Software Engineer (Python)
Job_Description:
COVID-19 continues to significantly impact our employees, families and communities. With employee health and safety as our top priority, and as a federal contractor, Lockheed Martin is taking action to address the increased risk and uncertainty COVID-19 variants pose in the workplace and ensuring we meet our commitments to national security.

To uphold safety for all employees, we will continue to request vaccination status for all Lockheed Martin employees including new hires. All current and newly hired employees are required to follow onsite safety measures based upon the COVID-19 Community Level at the specific work location.
Description:Come and experience your future!

Be the best possible you!

At Lockheed Martin, we are passionate about innovation and integrity. We believe that by applying the highest standards of business ethics and forward-thinking, everything is within our capacity – and yours as a Lockheed Martin employee. Lockheed Martin values your skills, training, education, and background.

Do you want to be part of an environment that encourages and supports employees to think big, perform with quality and build incredible products? We provide the resources, reassurance, and focus - if you have the resourcefulness and courage to work hard, then we want to build a better tomorrow with you.

Define the future of aviation. Stand at the forefront of technology and innovation. Transform your ideas and dreams into reality. Join Lockheed Martin’s Flight Controls and Autonomy team and be part of the greatest transformation in aviation history; unmanned fully autonomous flight.

The Flight Controls and Autonomy team is currently seeking highly motivated technology pioneers with a desire to steer and lead the Autonomy industry. Successful candidates must be willing and able to work on highly complex complicated problems.

Leading to world-changing technological breakthroughs.

Team’s technical areas of emphasis include Fly-By-Wire Flight Control Systems, Guidance/Navigation & Control (GNC), Flight Test, Autonomy, Aviation Robotics, Perception, AI, and Motion Planning.

This position is within the Flight Controls and Autonomy Software group located in Stratford, CT. This position requires a software engineer to work as part of a modeling and software development team. The team uses a wide application of modern technical principles, theories, and concepts in the software field to develop, integrate, and test conventional and fly-by-wire flight control system software products for Sikorsky’s helicopter platforms.

The candidate will be responsible for the planning, development, integration, and verification of flight control software. The candidate will be responsible for the software efforts as part of an Integrated Product Team (IPT) in the development and maintenance of flight control system software for a variety of platforms. Candidate responsibilities will span the software development lifecycle, including planning, requirements management, detail design and implementation, integration and test, flight test, and adjudicating change requests as the software is updated, tested, and integrated. Integration activities may include a multitude of host systems, such as live aircraft, simulated systems, and laboratory environments that include constructive simulations, physical hardware, and system simulations.

The successful candidate will work with a multi-program and multi-disciplinary team and must be self-motivated with a strong work ethic, time-management, and interpersonal skills. The successful candidate must have demonstrated effective communication skills as the position will require frequent inter-organizational and potential outside customer interactions.

C/C++ programming experience is required. Cross compiler toolchain development experience is required. Working knowledge of different Avionics data buses (ARINC-429, MIL-STD-1553, IEEE 1394, Ethernet and Time-Triggered Ethernet) is required. Experience with DO-178B/C, DO-330, and DO-331 is required. The ability to work at all levels of the software lifecycle is required. Experience with MATLAB, Simulink, Stateflow and Embedded Coder is required. Development and use of Python and PERL scripting tools is required.

In addition to the responsibilities highlighted above we offer extensive benefits that include competitive 401k and insurance. We remain an equal opportunity company.

Job Description:
Leidos is looking for scientific programmers, computer scientists, or mathematicians with an Artificial Intelligence/Machine Learning (AI/ML) background to support our growing work in the King of Prussia, PA or the Eglin AFB, FL office.
In this capacity you will propose, design and develop new Artificial Intelligence/Machine Learning (AI/ML) tools to support the design and analysis of high speed weapons systems. Leidos presently uses deep learning Artificial Neural Networks (ANN)s for the purpose of providing fast running models, and thus you would maintain existing ANN’s in addition to developing new ANN based fast running models.

Description:The Training Systems Integrated Engineering Team is working on many exciting programs and developing cutting edge products and applications to meet the complex and evolving needs of our customers. We are looking for talented engineers to join our team, working with other engineering disciplines to develop many best-in-class products and solutions. The Engineer will participate in phases of a complex software systems development lifecycle (SDLC), leveraging our DevOps engineering processes and procedures while performing respective engineering activities. The successful candidate will be flexible, motivated, dedicated, detail-focused, team oriented, and capable of multi-tasking. Positions are in East Orlando, FL at the Rotary and Mission Systems (RMS) Lake Underhill Facility. In this important role the engineer will collaborate with other program personnel, participating in cross functional Agile teams. Keeping up to date on emerging technologies and tools will be encouraged.

Lockheed Martin has a strong reputation as being one of the best companies to work for in the US. We offer a continuous learning environment with strong career growth and advancement opportunities over the long-term. Learn more about Training Systems here.

We are looking for engineers to work on a team and develop a mixed reality training application. The software allows for accurate entity tracking to be used in live and virtual environments for war-like simulations. The team is comprised of highly motivated Hardware, Electrical, Software, and Systems Engineers working together in a lab environment to produce a first-of-its-kind training product.

AURA TECHNOLOGIES, LLC (AURA) is an advanced research and development (R&D) and technology company creating game-changing innovations for the US Department of Defense in Artificial Intelligence (AI) and in other systems-level implementation of cutting-edge technology. We are creating advanced intelligent power systems for the US Army; unconventional tactical lights for the US Marines; revolutionary satellite manufacturing for the US Air Force; and a range of AI platforms for DoD implementation. AURA partners with some of the best companies in the world, such as Boeing, Northrop Grumman, and Lockheed Martin. We also collaborate with the best and brightest at our nation’s universities, including Georgia Tech and NC State University.

If you are a smart, capable, and talented individual who possesses high integrity, thrives in a fast-paced environment, wants to chart your own course based on your capabilities, and is willing to be accountable for failures and successes, then continue reading because you may be the ideal candidate to join our growing R&D business.

Title: Principal Software Engineer (Python)
Job_Description:
COVID-19 continues to significantly impact our employees, families and communities. With employee health and safety as our top priority, and as a federal contractor, Lockheed Martin is taking action to address the increased risk and uncertainty COVID variants pose in the workplace and ensuring we meet our commitments to national security.

To uphold safety for all employees, we will continue to request vaccination status for all Lockheed Martin employees including new hires. All current and newly hired employees who are unvaccinated will be required to adhere to onsite safety protocols.
Description:This job is aligned with our 21st Century Warfare (21CWFAIA) initiative to help the U.S. and its allies leverage emerging technologies to deter threats to economic prosperity and national security.

Come and experience your future!

Be the best possible you.

At Lockheed Martin, we are passionate about innovation and integrity. We believe that by applying the highest standards of business ethics and forward-thinking, everything is within our capacity – and yours as a Lockheed Martin employee. Lockheed Martin values your skills, training, education, and background.

Do you want to be part of an environment that encourages and supports employees to think big, perform with quality and build incredible products? We provide the resources, reassurance, and focus - if you have the resourcefulness and courage to work hard, then we want to build a better tomorrow with you.

Define the future of aviation. Stand at the forefront of technology and innovation. Transform your ideas and dreams into reality. Join Lockheed Martin’s Flight Controls and Autonomy team and be part of the greatest transformation in aviation history; unmanned fully autonomous flight.

The Flight Controls and Autonomy team is currently seeking highly motivated technology pioneers with a desire to steer and lead the Autonomy industry. Successful candidates must be willing and able to work on highly complex challenging problems, leading to world-changing technological breakthroughs.

Team’s technical areas of emphasis include Fly-By-Wire Flight Control Systems, Guidance/Navigation & Control (GNC), Flight Test, Autonomy, Aviation Robotics, Perception, AI and Motion Planning.

This is a technical position associated with the verification of Fly-By-Wire Flight Control System Software with an emphasis on Flight Control System Architecture, Autonomy, Flight Controls, and Guidance/Navigation and Control. The general scope of the work involves generation of test cases and results to test Matlab/Simulink and hand-code modules in accordance with the objectives of RTCA/DO-178B/C for software components at all design assurance levels (Level A-E). Leading to world-changing technological breakthroughs.

Verification activities include functional level testing, structural coverage (Statement, Decision, MCDC, object level), execution of test cases, generation of test results (i.e., test logs, listings, and coverage results), test case tracking, and test results reviews. The applicant will also be responsible for Requirements Based Level Testing of both High-Level (HLR) and Low-Level (LLR) software requirements.

In addition to the responsibilities highlighted above we offer extensive benefits that include competitive 401k and insurance. We remain an equal opportunity company.

Look no further, the future of aviation is here. Join our awesome team today!

B.S. Electrical Engineering or
B.S. Computer Engineering or
B.S. Aerospace Engineering or
B.S. Robotics Engineering

Control Systems, Signal Processing or Autonomy academic background. Control, Guidance, Navigation or Autonomy Vehicle experience (preferably in the aviation field) via academic projects or professional experience. Design and implementation of Multy-Layer state machines. Experience in Target-Vehicle (aircraft or other) Systems Engineering in the areas of design, integration and test. Model based design experience. Experience in FAA certification procedures such as 178B/C and/or DO-254. Private Pilot license or any other aviation/piloting training. Familiarity with any the following Software/System tools: Matlab, Simulink, DOORs, C/C++, Machine Learning or Python.

Red Canyon Software is looking for a Venue Reliability Engineer (VRE) to work on the Psyche program for our JPL/NASA customer.

A Venue Reliability Engineer (VRE) is a multi-disciplined engineer that works closely with Ground Data System’s Subsystems and infrastructure team to ensure that the project GDS venue (environment) is operational and reliable. The Ground Data Systems (GDS) is the computing IT infrastructure and facilities required to operate the mission operations system (MOS). It includes the software, computing hardware, voice and data communications, information systems, and networking equipment needed to conduct these mission operations. The GDS is comprised of multiple subsystems.

With employee health and safety as our top priority, and as a federal contractor, Lockheed Martin is taking action to address the increased risk and uncertainty COVID-19 variants pose in the workplace and ensuring we meet our commitments to national security.

To uphold safety for all employees, we will continue to request vaccination status for all Lockheed Martin employees including new hires. All current and newly hired employees are required to follow onsite safety measures based upon the COVID-19 Community Level at the specific work location.
Description:Advanced Systems & Analysis Engineer
Member of the Advanced Systems & Analysis department, responsible for research, development and analysis of new, innovative, systems and technologies. Initial assignment will primarily be to provide support to the Trident Submarine Navigation program.

Specific duties include:
Analyze complex inertial and sonar based high performance navigation systems. Participate in the development of the next generation Trident navigation system and enhance the capabilities of the current system. Support system testing, analysis tool development and maintenance, analyze test results, conduct accuracy and performance analysis, document and present results. Analyze current operational system performance, investigate operational issues, propose and develop solutions to mitigate concerns and document findings and recommendations.

1. Knowledge of time domain and frequency domain data processing techniques
2. Knowledge of probability & statistics
3. Proficient and skilled at using Matlab
4. Experience coding in a high-level programming language (Python, Java, C/C++. etc.)
5. Proficient working within both Windows and Unix/Linux environment
6. Ability to obtain Top Secret none prior to start
8. Ability for occasional travel
9. Bachelor’s degree from an accredited college in a related discipline, or equivalent experience/combined education.

1. M.S. or equivalent advanced degree in directly applicable technical discipline
2. Top Secret or Secret clearance (current or held within the last 5 years)
3. Experience with inertial navigation system error modeling and simulation (aided/unaided)
4. Knowledge of estimation and control theory including Kalman filtering and smoothing
5. Knowledge of AI/ML theory and techniques and application to real-world analyses
6. Experience with acoustic and sonar modeling and analysis
7. Familiarity with system and component specifications, understanding of requirement flow-down, allocation, validation and verification processes
8. Familiarity with GPS and/or Sonar systems
9. Experience using Mathematica and/or Scientific Python
10. Experience writing shell scripts (BASH)
11. Familiarity with M.S. Office Suite (Excel, Word, PowerPoint)
12. Familiarity with MongoDB
13. Proficiency with technical writing and documentation
14. Teamwork: Ability to work collaboratively with both local and geographically distributed teammates including subcontractors, technical agents and customers
15. Excellent demonstrated interpersonal and time management skillsets

Description:Lockheed Martin Aeronautics. Be More Than You Can Imagine.

This exciting position is with the Mission Control Systems Team supporting the Advanced Software team located in Fort Worth, Texas. This position is for an experienced Engineer to use and apply technical standards, principles, theories, concepts, and techniques in the Artificial Intelligence and software field to develop solutions to complex problems within Advanced Development Programs (ADP).

The selected candidate will focus on the of products that implement to provide discriminating Artificial Intelligence (AI) technologies/capability to our customers. This will require engagement in every phase of the system lifecycle including requirements generation, system and design, implementation, integration, and flight test. Activities will range from proof of concepts, of prototypes, developing demonstrators, and transition to production. The candidate will help to shape R D opportunities (CRAD, CRADA, internal/external collaborations) with a focus on customer science and technology organizations, such as DARPA, AFRL or ONR.

Key Responsibilities
Must exhibit self-motivation, an excellent work ethic, time and interpersonal skills.

There is a preference for the selected candidate to be based in Fort Worth, TX with the core team.

****Interim Secret clearance required with ability to obtain a Top Secret clearance****

Latent AI believes in a vibrant and sustainable future driven by the power of AI. Our mission is to enable the vast potential of AI that is efficient, practical and useful.
We are a diverse, ambitious team of scientists, engineers, entrepreneurs and visionaries revolutionizing how the next generation AI systems are built. Latent AI is backed by Future Ventures, Blackhorn Ventures, Auto Tech Ventures, Booz Allen Hamilton, Lockheed Martin, 40 North Ventures, Pegasus Tech Ventures, and SRI International.

Description:
At Lockheed Martin, we believe that by applying the highest standards of business ethics and forward-thinking, everything is within our reach – and yours as a Lockheed Martin employee. We value your unique skills and expertise, and we aim to give back continuously by offering a wide variety of benefits and amenities to help our employees live flexible, balanced, and fulfilling lives at, and outside of, work.

Lockheed Martin Rotary and Mission has an opportunity in Syracuse, NY for astute software engineering professionals.

Our Radar Line of business is looking for experienced software developers that have the confidence to solve complex problems on our Agile development teams. We are looking for individuals that have a can-do attitude in a diverse and challenging environment.

The Software Engineer plans, conducts, and coordinates software development activities. Designs, develops, documents, tests, and debugs software that contains logical and mathematical solutions to business/mission problems or questions in computer language for solutions by means of data processing equipment. Applies the appropriate standards, processes, procedures, and tools throughout the development life cycle. Applies knowledge of computer hardware and software, subject matter to be programmed in business/mission applications, information processing techniques used, and information gathered from system users to develop software. Corrects program errors, prepares operating instructions, compiles documentation of program development, and analyzes system capabilities to resolve questions of program intent, output requirements, input data acquisition, programming techniques, and controls. Ensures software standards are met.

GPU experience
C++ experience
Linux
Software Design & Development Experience
Problem Solver
Can Do attitude
Team Player

Bachelor's degree from an accredited college in a related discipline, or equivalent experience/combined education, with 2 years of professional experience; or no experience required with a related Master's degree. Considered experienced, but still a learner.

CUDA (Nvidia) experience
Software Design experience
Software integration
Software Architecture knowledge
JAVA
Software Debug & troubleshooting
Configuration Management tools (JIRA, GIT, etc)
Agile Development

Description:By bringing together people that use their passion for purposeful innovation, at Lockheed Martin we keep people safe and solve the world's most complex challenges. Our people are some of the greatest minds in the industry and truly make Lockheed Martin a great place to work. With our employees as our priority, we provide diverse career opportunities designed to propel development and boost agility. Our flexible schedules, competitive pay, and comprehensive benefits enable our employees to live a health, fulfilling life at and outside of work. At Lockheed Martin, we place an emphasis on empowering our employees by fostering innovation, integrity, and exemplifying the epitome of corporate responsibility.

Your Mission is Ours.

Lockheed Martin Space in Littleton, Colorado & Sunnyvale, California is seeking a full-time Early Career Software Engineer.

As a Software Engineer for the Special Programs (SP), you will join a multi-discipline team executing activities required to design and deliver state-of-the-art Intelligence, Surveillance, and Reconnaissance (ISR) mission processing software applications and advanced intelligence producing algorithms. APM has been accelerating development of new apps to meet critical mission needs of our customers. You will be responsible for the design, development, integration and testing of new apps. You will also work collaboratively in product teams to successfully deliver mission processing apps to operational software baselines and will directly drive an impact to real-world operations and national security.

Software Engineer responsibilities will include:

Degree in Computer Science, Computer , Aerospace or other STEM related degree program from an accredited college/university.

Ability to obtain and maintain a TS/SCI ; US citizenship is required

Experience in C++ and/or Python
Knowledge of Agile methodology

Lockheed Martin Space in Littleton, Colorado & Sunnyvale, California is seeking a full-time Early Career Software Engineer.

APM has been accelerating development of new apps to meet critical mission needs of our customers. You will be responsible for the design, development, integration and testing of new apps. You will also work collaboratively in product teams to successfully deliver mission processing apps to operational software baselines and will directly drive an impact to real-world operations and national security.

This position will support an IRAD that can be worked remote or hybrid until security clearance is in place and then work transitions to program on-site.

Software Engineer responsibilities will include:

Degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Aerospace Engineering or other STEM related degree program from an accredited college/university.

C++ and/or Python experience
Understanding of Agile Software Development processes

Must be a US Citizen ; this position will require obtaining a government security clearance. This position is located at a facility that requires special access.

Description:At Lockheed Martin, we believe that by applying the highest standards of business ethics and forward-thinking, everything is within our reach – and yours as a Lockheed Martin employee. We value your unique skills and expertise, and we aim to give back continuously by offering a wide variety of benefits and amenities to help our employees live flexible, balanced, and fulfilling lives at, and outside of, work.

Lockheed Martin Rotary and Mission Systems has an opportunity in Owego, NY and Stratford CT for an entry level Software Engineer supporting the eTech Mission Systems organization. As a new college hire on our Software Engineering team, you can help us take on the world’s most important and complex challenges by performing limited scope assignments with support of your team. In this important role, you will collaborate with a diverse team of technical professionals.
We are seeking candidates interested in being part of a high-performing, cohesive Agile software product team developing the software applications for fixed wing aircraft, vertical lift aircraft, human space flight. As a member of the Agile development team, the candidate should be comfortable with the full SW development cycle which includes requirements analysis, software design, implementation, and test (including automated testing).

The candidate should be productive working in a team-oriented environment. With daily interaction with systems engineers, software team members, and integration and test engineers being the key to program success, the ideal candidate should possess strong written, verbal and inter-personal communication skills. The desired candidate should be versatile and able to respond to the demand of producing working software in the short development cycles prescribed by Agile development.

Applications development opportunities include development of mission planning software, mission systems for aircraft and development of crew displays for aircraft and space vehicles. Potential applications include data management software, user interface software, embedded avionics and/or mission software applications; unmanned systems flight and ground station software.

Position Responsibilities performed in a supportive/assistive capacity:



The successful candidate will be flexible, motivated, dedicated, detail-focused, team-oriented, and capable of multi-tasking.

Description:The coolest jobs on this planet... or any other... are with Lockheed Martin Space. At the dawn of a new space age, Lockheed Martin a pioneer, partner, innovator, and builder. Our amazing people are on a mission to make a difference in the world and every day we use our outstanding skills and experiences to create, craft and build solutions to some of the worlds’ hardest engineering problems. Our culture supports employees to dream big, perform with excellence and create incredible products. We provide the resources, encouragement and focus and if you have the passion, we want to build a better tomorrow with you!

Across Lockheed Martin, and the defense industry, there’s a fourth industrial revolution occurring. Customers are looking for companies to address their needs faster, produce prototypes sooner, and remain price competitive. Digital transformation is the answer. At its core, digital transformation means taking manual, labor intensive processes and upgrading the tools, format, or processes themselves to complete them faster and with greater insight. It's not something that will be done for us, but something that we all must do together to ensure FBM's legacy of excellence continues for generations.

As a member of the FBM Transformation & Training Excellence Organization, you’ll be responsible to
plan, conduct, and coordinate software development activities for digital transformation and modernization of the FBM Program. You will design, develop, document, test, and debug software that contains logical and mathematical solutions to business/mission problems or questions in computer language for solutions by means of data processing equipment. All work shall apply the appropriate standards, processes, procedures, and tools throughout the development life cycle. In addition, all work shall apply knowledge of computer hardware and software, subject matter to be programmed in business/mission applications, information processing techniques used, and information gathered from system users to develop software. Throughout each project lifecycle, you will correct program errors, prepare operating instructions, compile documentation of program development, and analyze system capabilities to resolve questions of program intent, output requirements, input data acquisition, programming techniques, and controls. And finally, ensure software standards are met. Continuous communications with IS team and Digital Transformation team is crucial to success in this role. The FBM transformation team is looking for motivated individuals that can communicate effectively to help bridge the program from sustainment of yesterday to development and sustainment for continual improvement throughout the lifecycle of the program.

Lockheed Martin Aeronautics in Valencia, California is seeking a full-time Early Career System Integration Test Engineer. In this role, you will assist with testing Developmental and Production for our Rye Canyon facility testing articles for both active and passive antenna radar systems and sub-systems within the Signature Management and Survivability (SM&S) department.

Routine tasks include coordinating test plans with customers and test Engineers, test set-up, calibration of test systems, acquiring and reducing data, and performing routine maintenance on measurement equipment. The successful candidate will have experience and/or knowledge of RF/microwave network and spectrum analyzers in addition to RCS measurement technique and related equipment is desired. The ability to provide technical support in implementation, troubleshooting, and repair of RF/microwave hardware is desired.

Experience in near-field and far-field RF/microwave and High Power RF/microwave measurements is desired. Duties will include the coordination and the execution of tasks related to testing and analysis of RF/microwave hardware, systems, and sub-systems.

May be required to support extended or odd shifts and overtime.

For this position we are seeking someone who is:



Owego, New York is located about 200 miles northwest of New York City and about 75 miles south of Syracuse, New York. Owego sits just north of the border with Pennsylvania and is part of what's known as the "Southern Tier" section of New York State. The region is home to Binghamton University and Cornell University. Niagara Falls, NYC, & Philadelphia are all within a few hours’ drive from Owego. Rolling hillsides, historic homes, quaint country shops, riverside restaurants, unique farm tours, fabulous festivals and a beautiful river make this region a great place to live and work.

At Lockheed Martin, we apply our passion for purposeful innovation to keep people safe and solve the world's most complex challenges. Description:Job Description :
The coolest jobs on this planet… or any other… are with Lockheed Martin Space!

At the dawn of a new space age, Lockheed Martin is a pioneer, partner, innovator and builder. Our amazing people are on a mission to make a difference in the world and every day we use our outstanding skills and experiences to create, craft and build solutions to some of the worlds’ hardest engineering problems. Our culture supports employees to dream big, perform with excellence and create incredible products. We provide the resources, encouragement and focus and if you have the passion, we want to build a better tomorrow with you!

We are going to Mars and beyond! Will you join us in the journey?
Develops, modifies and applies quality principles to the development and use of software and software-based systems for make and/or buy software products. Performs verification and validation of test equipment including hardware in the loop systems. Develops overall operating criteria to ensure implementation of the software quality program according to project, process and contract requirements and objectives. Designs and implements software development and maintenance processes. Defines audit strategy to ensure compliance to systems/software processes. Designs, specifies and conducts test methods for software inspection, verification and validation. Evaluates and analyzes software quality systems for deficiency identification and correction. Ensures measures meet acceptable reliability standards. Performs software product reviews against contractual, technical and/or process requirements. Reviews include requirement specifications, design documents, source code, test plans and procedures, materials, tools, techniques, and methodologies. Performs or directs verification of software requirement allocations, traceability, and testability.

Perform reviews and inspections of program artifacts/deliverables and associated activities to assure quality requirements processes and standards are met. Analyze measurement data to ensure quantitative measurement effectiveness and to eradicate defects. Plan, manage and perform process and product evaluations (audits). Monitor the product development, integration, test and acceptance of products. Monitor the development metrics. Participate in process improvement. Perform shipping and receiving inspections, manage an equipment calibration schedule, manage electrostatic discharge workbenches and assign instructions for validating product entering into the supply chain.

Responsibilities include applying the appropriate standards, processes, procedures and tools throughout the development life cycle. Apply knowledge of computer hardware and software, programming experience, information processing techniques and information captured from system users, to improve the level of SQE technical reviews of software products and processes. Participate in program level boards and reviews such as SRB and peer review activities. Implement software quality plans and procedures. Conduct software evaluation activities related to software development and conducts software subcontractor evaluations as advised.

Evaluate requirements, design, development, configuration management, builds, documentation, integration, testing and release of deliverable/non-deliverable software deliveries and installations using established procedures as a guide. Some travel may be required in this position.

Flexibility to evaluate and disposition engineer hardware in writing and processing non-conformances documentation. Role to have a diverse array of responsibilities to include collaboration with design engineering and suppliers for requirements development and verification, auditing supplier systems for deficiency identification and correction, supplier process improvement, ensuring that corrective measures are robust and effective, and verifying that hardware and supporting documentation is compliant.

As a member of our Code Name: “DogPatch” software development team, you will work within an Agile Product team focused on technical development, bug fixes, and enhancements of front-end and/or back-end portions of our Command and Control Systems supporting airborne platforms. Experience in a Windows environment using MS Visual Studio.

Active DoD Top Secret Security Clearance a big plus.

Title: Software Engineer / Game Developer
Job_Description:
COVID-19 continues to significantly impact our employees, families and communities. Description:This position is with our Advanced Development Programs known as the Skunk Works located in Marietta, GA. This is a full-time technical engineering position for the Virtual Prototyping group. The Virtual Prototyping group is an advanced visualization provider of Modeling and Simulation (M&S) services and solutions to Lockheed Martin Corporation and its customers worldwide. Through the power of advanced visualization, Virtual Prototyping helps people understand complex systems and ideas by “bringing concepts to life,” allowing for better, faster decision making and, ultimately, assisting programs in winning new business and performing on existing programs. From conceptual design to sustainment, Virtual Prototyping provides discriminating technologies to support the complete product life cycle that articulate information using simulation, visualization, virtual collaboration, human computer interfaces, and synthetic real-time environments. These capabilities save time, reduce costs and risks, improve quality, and enhance safety by increasing product and process understanding. The group provides unique capabilities and tailored solutions through product visualization, manufacturing simulation, serious games applications, vehicle simulation, operational awareness, virtual training, maintainability & sustainment operations, virtual & augmented reality, battle space visualization, continuous improvement efforts, facilities development, and much more.

This software engineering position requires having a strong and diverse technical background being able to develop, integrate, and apply various modeling and simulation technologies/methods in the fields of advanced visualization, simulation, and human computer interfaces. Individual must be able to learn and quickly pickup technical concepts and software applications in effort to apply them to meet demanding program requirements. Candidate needs to have a strong programming (i.e. C++, C#, Java, .net, XML, etc.) background for rapid software prototyping development and the ability to integrate code into 3D applications including gaming technologies, augmented reality, virtual reality, and other real-time simulation tools. The candidate will be responsible to work with the Virtual Prototyping software development team on real-time 3D M&S applications and other software development tasks. The candidate will also be leveraged for additional M&S research and development tasks.

The candidate will be providing technical leadership in various software development tasks and will be establishing a Virtual Prototyping presence in the LM-Aero Marietta, GA location. The candidate needs to have leadership and project management skills, the ability to establish/maintain positive and effective professional relationships with remotely located team members, cross functional organizations, and leadership across all LM-Aero locations. Individual we need to be able to promote and socialize Virtual Prototyping capabilities to establish new work opportunities. The candidate should have excellent communication skills, be a self-starter, be able to multi-task in a time critical environment working well under pressure and make effective oral and written presentations to both technical and non-technical audiences.

(1) Programming and scripting experience in C++/C# and other coding languages. (2) Experience with real-time3D tools including game engine programming experience in Unity. (3) Project management experience. (4) System administration. (5) Experience in the UI/UX development

(1) Certified Unity Professional. (2) Presagis tools (Vega Prime and Creator), MaK VR’s DI-Guy, DiSTI’s GL Studio as well as an understanding of vehicle flight dynamics to support visual simulations. (3) Specific experience with gaming technologies such as Unreal, CryEngine, Unity3D, and Prepar3D. (4) Web based programming (i.e. HTML5, SQL, CSS, ASP, Ajax, WebGL, etc.). (5) 3D graphics programming to include GPGPU, OpenGL, DirectX, etc. (6) Programming languages including C++, C#, Python, .Net, VB, XML, Perl, etc.

Description:LM has new opportunities that provide you with a chance to challenge the status quo and experiment with new digital tools and emerging technologies that transform our mission.

Due to the classified nature of this opportunity we can’t talk about everything you’ll do on this program, but know that you will play a part in building end-to-end solutions and game-changing technology.

Lockheed Martin is looking for a dedicated Ground Segment Liaison Systems Engineer to join the team in Denver, Colorado. As the Ground Segment Liaison, you will be responsible for coordinating with the mission Customer, System Integrator and Ground Segment to define, validate and verify open architecture ground system interfaces that ensure interoperability in an ABMS/JADC2 environment. You will be a part of a team that will identify and pursue mission improvements to maximize interoperability and associated growth opportunities. Your Mission is Ours

Lockheed Martin Rotary and Mission Systems in Mount Laurel, NJ is seeking a full-time Early Career Systems Engineers (Modeling, Simulation & Analysis).

You will participate in design, development, integration, and testing of new capabilities for several Department of Defense (DoD) products and technologies. You will use and contribute to models of real-world weapons, radars, Command & Control systems, and communication networks. You will independently identify and address system and software defects, demonstrate an ability to practice sound systems and software engineering discipline, and decompose complex problems to formulate solutions.

In this role you will perform analysis for several products. The candidate will use mathematical models and simulation products to perform mission analysis, ConOps development, gap analysis, concept exploration, sensitivity and trade studies, system requirements validation, detailed design verification, model driven test, and performance prediction in Ballistic Missile Defense and Anti-Air Warfare mission areas.

The successful candidate will have experience and/or knowledge of Unix, Linux, Python, C/C++, MATLAB to develop scripts and code, engineering methods to perform root cause analysis, statistical and Data Analytics methods to understand and derive performance requirements.

Must be a US Citizen; this position will require a
government security clearance. This position is located at a facility that requires special access.

The Locale: Owego, New York is located about 200 miles northwest of New York City and about 75 miles south of Syracuse New York. About us
SimuLogix LLC is an Aerospace/Defense Systems Engineering Service Provider with 25+ years of Launch Vehicle and Spacecraft experience (including ground systems). We are a small business focusing on Guidance, Navigation & Controls Systems; System Engineering; Software Engineering; Electrical Engineering (e.g. digital design/avionics, high-power electronics, RF/Communications, EMI/EMC, EO/IR, etc…) and Mechanical Engineering (e.g. structural analysts, solid modelers, thermal engineers, etc…). Our company headquarters are located in California, but our engineers located throughout the country. SimuLogix holds a TS Facility clearance. Several of our engineers have TS/SCI clearances. We have years of experience working with spacecraft & launch systems integrators including Aerojet-Rocketdyne, Lockheed-Martin, Raytheon, Northrop-Grumman, General Dynamics, Boeing, Orbital-ATK (NGC IS), APL, SNC, as well as their suppliers, e.g. Moog, Honeywell, Draper Labs,…. Additionally we have been working with companies focused on some of the newer commercial and/or crossover technologies including UAVs, cube satellites (e.g. Planet Labs) and 3D metal printers. As all of us across the industry have realized we must deal with Cyber Security and hence we are starting up a Cyber Security division having recently hired a new manager to lead that. We now have both hardware and software Cyber Security engineers onboard.

The RMS Cyber Resiliency (CyRes) organization is looking for a talented Cyber Systems Security Engineer (CSSE) Technical Lead to join our team in Orlando, FL. The technical lead will be managing the F-35 Cyber Pilot Training Devices (PTD) team supporting the F-35 Training & Logistics (T&L) Market Segment under the Training & Logistics Solutions (TLS) Line of Business (LOB). Description:Artificial Intelligence / Machine Learning Engineer (Python and Tactical Software Focused AI Engineer)

The Lockheed Martin Artificial Intelligence Center (LAIC) is seeking a high energy individual with a strong working knowledge in software engineering, AI, and machine learning to support the AI Innovations organization and product portfolio. The organization is comprised of small, innovative, and agile teams focused on rapidly maturing solutions from prototypes to deployment for utilization across the Lockheed Martin enterprise and in the field for our customers.

The selected candidate will focus on the development of technologies and products that leverage Artificial Intelligence to provide state of the art signal processing software capabilities to our customers. This will require engagement in every phase of the system development lifecycle including requirements generation, system and software design, implementation, integration, and flight test, with an emphasis on Python based software development. Activities will range from low TRL research, proof of concepts, development of prototypes, building demonstrators, and transition to production. The selected candidate can expect to utilize current AI paradigms including deep learning, signal processing, computer vision, reinforcement learning, to integrate these technologies into DoD customer systems, in order to solve complex problems and field innovative solutions.

Must exhibit self-motivation, a strong work ethic, time management and interpersonal skills.

There is a strong preference for the selected candidate to be based in Moorestown, NJ or Cherry Hill, NJ. This candidate could also potentially be located in Shelton, Connecticut. Candidates can expect to spend 25% or more of their time performing hands-on development of radio-frequency (RF) and digital signal processing (DSP) systems.

Must be a US Citizen.

Description:ATMP Soldier Systems Contact Team Member

This position is located at the Central Depot in Louisville, KY. This position provides technical over-and-above training support, technical assistance, and maintenance support for Close Combat Tactical Trainer (CCTT) Family of Training Devices, Soldier Systems (SS) Aviation and Transportation (AT) Army Training Aids, Devices, and Simulators (TADSS), and Gunnery Maintenance Trainers (GMDT) family of devices; providing on demand device support across a broad spectrum of CCTT, SS/AT/TADSS, aviation, and GMDT family of training devices. This position will require travel 50-75% of the time.

Army TADSS Soldier Systems are designed to simulate live weapons, crew, convoy, vehicle, flight, and tactical training events that directly support individual and crew-served qualification, including individual gunnery and marksmanship, small unit collective, operating qualifications, and judgmental escalation-of-force exercises in a controlled environment.

The candidate shall receive Original Equipment Manufacturer (OEM) training on all CCTT, SS/AT/TADSS, and GMDT Full fidelity devices, and shall possess the abilities and technical expertise to perform the following tasks worldwide:

a) Extend training device operational, maintainability, and training capabilities by performing necessary upgrades, modifications, improvements, and retro-fits.

b) Provide recommendations to OPS-SS in the support and enhancement of maintenance procedures on all CCTT, SS/AT/TADSS, and GMDT training devices.

c) Conduct on site train-up for all newly hired field technicians.

d) Build, distribute, and implement training support packages for various CCTT, SS/AT/TADSS, and GMDT training devices for use in training field technicians worldwide.

e) Provide subject matter technical support for CCTT, SS/AT/TADSS, and GMDT devices and associated maintenance areas such as electrical, mechanical, hardware and software.

f) Provide platform specific refresher/remedial training on CCTT, SS/AT/TADSS, and GMDT simulation platforms/devices.

g) Provide expertise to assist with engineering development and applications.

h) Assist with and provide technical support for multi-platform software integration and support, along with verification/validation capabilities.

i) Provide and assist with site surveys and aid in the creation of drawings and technical support packages for new construction projects to include pad construction and site layouts for CCTT, SS/AT/TADSS, and GMDT training platforms/devices.

j) Provide domain expert labor and expertise for pad constructions for new simulation sites, buildings, and locations by performing various tasks such as room and building validations and inspections, trenching, grounding grid installation, electrical service installation, voltage and phasing verification, bearing plate and tie down installation, and general construction oversight and assistance.

k) Provide technical expertise and recommendations to logistics teams on material handling equipment (MHE) requirements to support movement or relocation of CCTT, SS/AT/TADSS, and GMDT training platforms/devices.

l) Develop upon request documentation that will support de-installation, installation and relocation of all CCTT, SS/AT/TADSS, and GMDT devices in support of Department of Transportation (DOT) requirements; Air, Rail, Ship.

m) Perform, conduct, and lead device and site relocations to include but not limited to the testing, inventory, packing, shipping, receiving, set-up, and bringing training devices and full sites to fully mission capable status.

n) Provide/Conduct emergency training, surge and maintenance support.

o) Provide hardware/software technical support for all CCTT, SS/AT/TADSS, and GMDT devices worldwide.

p) Single source / domain expertise to support / execute training device pack
US Citizenship is required.

This requires US Citizenship.

Must have an industry related two-year bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience.

Description:WHO WE ARE
At Lockheed Martin Aeronautics, we're taking engineering creativity to the next level. From designing the most advanced air vehicle to designing aircraft that defy gravity, our engineers live on the cutting edge of technology. Never have the opportunities for a technical career been so limitless.
Our team is responsible for developing complex systems and platforms across many exciting domains. With that in mind, we value, innovation, creative thinking, self-motivation, and leading by example. Care to join us?

In this highly versatile role as a DevOps Engineer on our team, you will use your multitasking skills to balance everything from computer coding, testing, and deployment to figure out creative ways to integrate or replace legacy embedded systems processes with modern resources and workflows.
This career offers unique exposure, with the chance to get involved on the ground floor of exciting new programs, designing and developing new software and hardware components to be integrated into the future F-35, F-16, and our Skunk Works mission systems.
With exciting growth expected, we welcome the opportunity to play a part in your professional success story.
This position is in Louisville, Colorado. Located near the front range of the Rocky Mountains, Louisville, a suburb of Denver, is known for its 300 days of sunshine, thriving cultural scene, and natural beauty. The area offers nearly endless opportunities for nearby snow skiing, hiking, and nature viewing.
Learn more about our perks and benefits here at Lockheed Martin: Https://Www.Lockheedmartinjobs.Com/Working-Here#Benefits


On our team of skilled Embedded Systems, Software, and FPGA engineers, you will have exposure to a variety of products and platforms and will have the unique opportunity to make a positive impact in the lives of many by developing state-of-the-art embedded systems. You can thrive on our team by fostering positive working relationships with all stakeholders, from software engineering, test engineering, and IT to automate and deploy, build, and test the products and systems.

Must be able to obtain and maintain Special Access Programs (SAP) Access.
In depth knowledge of DoDM 5205.07 v1-4

Experience working in a military environment.

Experience in providing briefings and/or training

Description:This position may require rotational OCONUS deployments. Works directly with the Shift Lead to manage, control and direct resources to accomplish scheduled and unscheduled organizational-level maintenance utilizing applicable Air Force directives/instructions on MQ-9 aircraft and associated equipment. Directs and assists in the inspection, troubleshooting, and operations of deployed communications equipment to include Predator Primary Satellite Link Terminal, Ground Control Stations, Ground Data Terminals, standard 6 radio frequency, line-of-sight, beyond line-of-sight, wideband, ground-based satellite, peripheral computer/communications and cryptographic equipment. Schedules satellite communications airtime and coordinates link activation with Department of Defense and civilian agencies. Assembles, connects, secures and interconnects components such as transmitters, power supplies and antenna assemblies. Monitors and de-conflicts transmit/receive signals to ensure optimum performance and prevents interference with other satellite users. Installs network technical solutions for real-time video dissemination via Remote Split Operations architecture. May perform aircraft engine runs and weapons loading and unloading. Remains on the flightline, to the fullest extent possible, when maintenance personnel are performing flightline maintenance and launching/recovering aircraft. Enforces strict adherence to technical data and management procedures. Ensures aircraft and equipment forms and Maintenance Information System documentation is complete, accurate and accomplished. Implements disaster control duties and responsibilities pertaining to aircraft/SE movement and personnel evacuation. Follows established CANN procedures and updates CANN action status on assigned aircraft. Understands aircraft status and inventory reporting as covered in Air Force Instruction 21-103 and applicable supplements. Informs and provides aircraft status updates to Shift Lead and the Maintenance Operations Control Center. Verifies MICAP conditions exist and reviews MICAP‘s status daily for accuracy. Ensures strict compliance and adherence with environmental directives and applicable environmental protection/compliance guidance. Ensures compliance with applicable government safety directives, standards, and industrial safety publications. Encourages a work environment of zero accident and injuries including no lost time accidents.

Must have at least five (5) years experience in aircraft maintenance. Ability to obtain a Secret Security Clearance.

Desire at least one (1) year experience on MQ-1 and/or MQ-9 aircraft.

As a recruiter on this team you will lend your expertise in evaluating employment factors such as job experience, education, training, skills, knowledge and abilities to present qualified candidates for consideration to our hiring managers.

Description:This requisition supports the aircraft modification and heavy maintenance program supporting F-35 program requirements. The modification team will be based at Hill AFB, UT with potential travel requirements at other F-35 locations.

Selected candidate will have experience with understanding technical requirements on fighter type aircraft. Candidate must be able to read and interpret engineering drawings, technical manuals, structure repair manuals, understanding symbols, flags, and general notes Identify aircraft locations by station, butt-line, and waterline as shown on engineering documentation and technical orders.

Selected candidate will perform low observable (LO) maintenance to include coatings removal and restoration, Panel removal and installation, Structural repairs on metallic and composite components, TCTD's, Modifications, and other F-35 tasks/duties as assigned. Work daily with engineering drawings, technical manuals, structural repair manuals, and engineers as needed to perform assigned tasks





Physical Demands:
Regularly required to lift up to 50 pounds and perform repetitive movements, work overhead, to grasp, handle, and/or feel, reach. The employee is frequently required to stand, walk, stoop, kneel, squat, crawl, and twist. Will work in hot/cold climates in various facilities on site.

Must be a US Citizen. This position is located at a facility that requires special access.

Must have an Interim Secret Clearance prior to starting.

3 years Aircraft crew chief/Aircraft Plane General/Tactical Aircraft Maintenance Specialist experience/Sheet metal or Structures experience.

Must have been previously awarded a 5 or 7 Skill level USAF AFSC, Navy NEC, or Marine MOS discipline rating or an equivalent Airframe and Power Plant, FAA certificate, or Civil service WG-08.

Working level of knowledge on Maintenance Information Systems such as Electronic Maintenance Instructions, Aircraft Forms Documentation, and Supply Chain Management and Process Specifications.

Experience with Tool Control, FOD, Supply, HAZMAT, Training, Quality, and Security programs.

Fifth generation aircraft Crew Chief or Sheet Metal experience

Heavy Maintenance and/or Aircraft Modification experience.

Recent experience utilizing tools to include but not limited to drills, angle motors, shears, drill press, and pneumatic riveter.

Ability to fabricate detail parts such as shims, splices, gussets, angles, brackets, doublers, stiffeners, and patches - Use shop aids to facilitate assembly and installation as required.

Low Observable Coatings application

Description:Position is in Iraq; C-130J Avionics specialist; this position is for a highly motivated person to be responsible for performing daily organizational level maintenance in accordance with Iraq’s owned USAF/LM technical data and directives; render technical assistance to Iraqi personnel in the assembly, operation, service repair and modification of the C-130; investigate, provide advice, and report on the disposition of difficulties arising in the IqAF operation of aircraft equipment in service; conduct informal On-the-Job Training (OJT) to Iraqi Air Force technicians in the repair, replacement and service of C-130 Avionics systems and in the performance of preventive maintenance. Description:Here at Lockheed Martin's Rotary and Mission Systems (RMS) business in Moorestown, NJ we are responsible for integrating, testing, and demonstrating some of our customers most complex systems. As an engineer in our System Integration and Test (SI&T) department, you will be a part of the team responsible for high level system design, system test planning and test execution for our key customers, including US Navy, US Coast Guard, US Missile Defense Agency, US Air Force, and international customers.

This Full Stack Engineer role is within the Tools, Technology, and Process Group - which has responsibility for data analytics, test automation, and transformative technology adoption within the System Integration and Test (SI&T) department. The successful candidate will be responsible for developing, modifying, testing, deploying, and maintaining the Test Automation Framework (TAF) utilized in automated System-Level testing, and the System Test Pipeline (STP) infrastructure (scheduler, executor, and data pipeline) which enables it.

We are looking for an innovative thinker who will help to accelerate Lockheed Martin’s RMS operations by leveraging application development technologies to transform existing processes into automated systems. The successful candidate enjoys challenges, can work independently, and can learn new technologies quickly – your growth will be sponsored and championed within this organization.

About us
SimuLogix LLC is an Aerospace/Defense Systems Engineering Service Provider with 25+ years of Launch Vehicle and Spacecraft experience (including ground systems). We are a small business focusing on Guidance, Navigation & Controls Systems; System Engineering; Software Engineering; Electrical Engineering (e.g. digital design/avionics, high-power electronics, RF/Communications, EMI/EMC, EO/IR, etc…) and Mechanical Engineering (e.g. structural analysts, solid modelers, thermal engineers, etc…). Our company headquarters are located in California, but our engineers located throughout the country. SimuLogix holds a TS Facility clearance. Several of our engineers have TS/SCI clearances. We have years of experience working with spacecraft & launch systems integrators including Aerojet-Rocketdyne, Lockheed-Martin, Raytheon, Northrop-Grumman, General Dynamics, Boeing, Orbital-ATK (NGC IS), APL, SNC, as well as their suppliers, e.g. Moog, Honeywell, Draper Labs,…. Additionally we have been working with companies focused on some of the newer commercial and/or crossover technologies including UAVs, cube satellites (e.g. Planet Labs) and 3D metal printers. As all of us across the industry have realized we must deal with Cyber Security and hence we are starting up a Cyber Security division having recently hired a new manager to lead that. We now have both hardware and software Cyber Security engineers onboard.

Our amazing people are on a mission to make a difference in the world and every day we use our unique skills and experiences to create, design and build solutions to some of the worlds' hardest engineering problems. Our culture encourages employees to dream big, perform with excellence and create incredible products. We provide the resources, inspiration and focus and if you have the passion and courage to dream big, we want to build a better tomorrow with you.

The SmartSat, SmartMissile, and SmartRover team is looking for an experienced embedded software developer to participate in the development of application hosting infrastructure inclusive of industry standard containerization and application orchestration utilities. In addition to general application hosting, the candidate will also be involved in cyber security integration, Payload Software Integration and review activities to ensure a secure software environment onboard multiple spacecraft.

Job_Description:
Do you want to help a small company make a BIG difference in space? Do you take ownership of your job and responsibility for your actions? Then come work for Red Canyon and help us continue our mission of helping humankind reach the stars!

Red Canyon Software is looking for a Venue Reliability Engineer (VRE) to work on the Psyche program for our JPL/NASA customer.

A Venue Reliability Engineer (VRE) is a multi-disciplined engineer that works closely with Ground Data System’s Subsystems and infrastructure team to ensure that the project GDS venue (environment) is operational and reliable. The Ground Data Systems (GDS) is the computing IT infrastructure and facilities required to operate the mission operations system (MOS). It includes the software, computing hardware, voice and data communications, information systems, and networking equipment needed to conduct these mission operations. The GDS is comprised of multiple subsystems.

It includes knowledge of local, distributed, and cloud-based technologies; data virtualization and smart caching; and all security and authentication mechanisms required to protect the data.

Description:When you join Enterprise Technologies, you will be part of one of the most innovative and fastest moving organizations in Lockheed Martin. Come help build end-to-end Future Battle Management, Command & Control (FBMC2) systems and utilize our cutting-edge capabilities to bring advanced capability directly to the operational community through agile demonstrations and leave behind prototypes.

We are seeking a motivated and experienced Software Engineer to work within the Enterprise Technologies (eTech) Future Battle Management, Command & Control (FBMC2) organization that brings skills in DevSecOps and Cloud technologies. Come help build end-to-end FBMC2 systems and utilize our cutting-edge capabilities to bring advanced capability directly to the operational community through agile demonstrations and leave behind prototypes. Key to enabling this vision is embracing cloud computing and DevSecOps into our engineered agile solution frameworks across our portfolio.

As the lead for this effort, you will examine our current and future programs and guide the insertion of these technologies. In addition, you will work to stand-up a cross-program and IRAD capability that can be used across the portfolio to quickly enable new starts to develop using the latest DevSecOps and Cloud-based technologies. This is an exciting opportunity to take hold and guide future architectures!

Description:Our Lockheed Martin Missile and Fire Control Business Area in Orlando, Florida is seeking candidates for a role focused on High Performance Computing (HPC) and using supercomputing technologies to build the next generation of modeling & simulation capabilities. You will support dozens of clusters across thousands of servers (compute nodes) and tens of thousands of CPU cores.

To be considered for this role you must have an active Secret security clearance that has been investigated within the last 5 years.

This position has high customer engagement and will work with engineers, developers, and scientists across multiple departments to enable their applications for HPC. This involves working closely with both cluster users and IT Systems Engineers to design and build scalable HPC architecture, tool sets, and supporting infrastructure to meet engineering requirements.

Programming and scripting are a large component of this position, and you will be given the opportunity to grow their skills across multiple languages. You will benchmark and optimize hardware, fabric, software, storage, and other tunable components to maximize the performance and efficiency of applications on the HPC systems. This will include extensive low-level troubleshooting and manipulation of code and tools to identify solutions across a diverse set of problem areas.

In addition to work with cluster users and IT engineers, you will work with senior program management to ensure that HPC capabilities align with overall business strategy and demands by providing metrics and forecasting. The candidate will not only educate the engineering community on the capabilities that HPC can provide, but also train users one-on-one to develop code and scripts for HPC execution.

Candidates may be involved in special projects such as multi-level security (MLS) for HPC, big data analytics, DevSecOps CI/CD integration, Machine Learning (ML), and Hybrid Cloud.

You should be passionate in learning and growing the skills needed. Candidates may come from a diverse background in science and/or engineering such as computer, chemical, biology, electrical, mechanical, mathematics, aeronautical, or other disciplines.

Relocation assistance is possible for this position.

Possess an active DoD Top Secret security clearance, based upon a National Agency Check with Local Agency Check (NAC/LC) conducted within the last five years and access eligibility for Special Access Programs. The Tools team provides software application development tools to the Tactical team and to third party customers and partners in support of the day to day development of Machinery Controls and Automation products deployed on US Navy Ships and other commercial platforms. The Tools team is looking for engineers who bring innovation and new perspectives from many areas, including software/system architecture, information management, distributed computing, networking and database development, cybersecurity, artificial intelligence, and UI design. The successful candidate will assist in planning and coordinating all activities related to requirements gathering, analysis, design, software development and implementation of client information systems and software applications in an Agile Development Environment. Description:This position is for a security engineer supporting the Lockheed Martin Missiles and Fire Control Business Area, in the IT cyber security organization primarily supporting classified IT.

The candidate will act as a bridge between classified IT systems engineers and Information Systems Security Officers/Managers (ISSO/ISSM); to design, test, and deliver technical solutions. Areas of focus will include secure multi-tenancy solutions (Protection Level 3/4), DevSecOps continuous integration/delivery (CI/CD), hybrid cloud, software defined networking (SDN), and more.

The Security Engineer will provide feedback to the development of Assessment & Authorization (A&A) packages, System Security Plans (SSP), Plan of Action and Milestones (POA&M), Security Controls Traceability Matrix (SCTM), and security control test plans for new system designs. This position requires interfacing with Industrial Security Classified Cyber, Classified IT, Engineering & Technology (E&T), and government customers to help drive security strategy. This is a dynamic, fast-paced environment where quick ramp-up and the ability to effectively manage multiple priorities is critical to success.

Description:The coolest jobs on this planet… or any other… are with Lockheed Martin Space.

At the dawn of a new space age, Lockheed Martin is a pioneer, partner, innovator and builder. Our amazing people are on a mission to make a difference in the world and every single day we use our unique skills, talents and experiences to design and build solutions to some of the world’s hardest engineering problems. Do you want to be part of a culture that inspires employees to envision the impossible, perform with excellence and build incredible products? We provide the resources, inspiration and focus—if you have the passion and courage to dream big, then we want to build a better tomorrow with you.

The Engineering & Technology organization supporting the Joint All Domain Operations (JADO) division within LM Space Mission Solutions is searching for a motivated and passionate Software or Project Engineer to join our Air Space Integration team. You will have the opportunity to support unclassified and classified projects. You will help coordinate activities between government customers, other Lockheed business areas, and ourselves.

You will be designing state-of-the-art concepts while delivering innovative and affordable capabilities in a new and emerging area of JADO. You will bring an understanding of sensor processing and be able to apply that understanding to schedule the course of work and monitor the risks therein.

You will be working on a mission that you can be proud of, knowing that you are making a lasting difference in the world and in space.

Candidates must be eligible to obtain access to classified USG information or already hold clearances.

Occasional travel may be required.

Description:Define the future of aviation. Stand at the forefront of technology and innovation. Transform your ideas and dreams into reality. Join Lockheed Martin’s Flight Controls and Autonomy team and be part of the greatest transformation in aviation history; unmanned fully autonomous flight.

The Flight Controls and Autonomy team is currently seeking highly motivated technology pioneers with a desire to steer and lead the Autonomy industry. Successful candidates must be willing and able to work on highly complex complicated problems, leading to world-changing technological breakthroughs.

The team’s technical areas of emphasis include Fly-By-Wire Flight Control Systems, Guidance/Navigation & Control (GNC), Flight Test, Autonomy, Aviation Robotics, Perception, AI, and Motion Planning.

In this role, the candidate will work with a team to build novel software architectures, algorithms, and tools for modeling the environment. This model representation fuses a-priori information (terrain, towers, airspaces, etc.) with real-time sensor data. The model representation is tightly integrated into aircraft motion planning to deliver a safe and smooth path for the aircraft. Other responsibilities include the development of databases and analytics tools to enable the collection and processing of very large terrain and point cloud-based data sets.

The candidate shall have a strong academic background and applied expertise in autonomous systems perception including computer vision, mapping, object detection, semantic segmentation, classification, camera/lidar calibration, and point cloud processing. Strong knowledge of the state-of-the-art research and emerging technology in perception, including various sensors. Strong applied background in working with systems with multiple perception sensors including cameras, Lidars, and Radar as well as sensor fusion algorithms.

The candidate shall have a fundamental understanding of motion planning for autonomous vehicles including integration of planning and perception systems. The ability to rapidly prototype innovative perception algorithms and transition them to flight test. Collaborate with other researchers and engineers across the autonomy and flight controls team. Support various programs to develop autonomy including software development, test, system integration and flight tests. The candidate shall have strong coding skills in C++, Python, MATLAB.

Look no further, the future of aviation is here. Join our awesome team today!

The Systems Administrator must maintains smooth operation of multi-user computer systems, including coordination with network engineers. Description:Sensor Tradecraft Optimization (STO) enables our organization to align with CSD priorities. STO is an end-to-end agnostic solution provider that analyzes sensor data, designs, and delivers automated solutions to optimize sensor collection. STO architects and engineer’s tradecraft threads to drive sensors to produce the highest value data and threat intelligences to improve the Nation’s cybersecurity posture.

TKO is seeking Data Scientists to support the Cyber Threat Intelligence initiative to support defense of our nation’s most critical unclassified and classified networks. The individual will interpret and manipulate data, analyze data sets, creates reports and data visualizations.

Tasking will consist of the following:

Bachelor's and Master's degree from an accredited college or university in a quantitative discipline (e.g., statistics, mathematics, operations research, engineering or computer science).

Five (5) years of experience analyzing datasets and developing analytics,

Five (5) years of experience programming with data analysis software such as R, Python, SAS, or MATLAB

Two (2) years of experience in software development, cloud development, analyzing datasets, or developing descriptive, predictive, and prescriptive analytics can be substituted for a Master's degree.

A PhD from an accredited college or university in a quantitative discipline can be substituted for three years of experience.

Description:The Lockheed Martin Rotary and Mission Systems (RMS) Artificial Intelligence (AI) team is seeking motivated engineers with a strong background in software engineering, DevOps, artificial intelligence and machine learning to support the RMS AI team and product portfolio.

The RMS AI team has an immediate opportunity for an engineer with a strong software background. The candidate will apply AI and optimization techniques to develop unique and proprietary solutions to our customers’ challenges. If you have an interest and passion for making AI / ML, this role is for you! At Lockheed Martin, we are driven by innovation and integrity, and we are excited to bring cutting edge technology to our customers & their missions.

This role is expected to utilize current AI paradigms, algorithms, and models (e.g. deep learning, reinforcement learning, computer vision); applying these techniques in relevant domains to tackle sophisticated problems and create innovative solutions. This also requires a candidate to maintain awareness of emerging analytics, AI / ML, and domain-specific technologies. This role requires working within an Agile Scrum environment, including supporting sprint meetings (review, retrospective and planning), planning poker and backlog grooming.

This job is aligned with our 21st Century Security (21CS AI) initiative to help the U.S. and its allies leverage emerging technologies to deter threats to economic prosperity and national security.

Description:Artificial Intelligence / Machine Learning Engineer (Python and Tactical Software Focused AI Engineer)

The Lockheed Martin Artificial Intelligence Center (LAIC) is seeking a high energy individual with a strong working knowledge in software engineering, AI, and machine learning to support the AI Innovations organization and product portfolio. The organization is comprised of small, innovative, and agile teams focused on rapidly maturing solutions from prototypes to deployment for utilization across the Lockheed Martin enterprise and in the field for our customers.

The selected candidate will focus on the development of technologies and products that leverage Artificial Intelligence to provide state of the art signal processing software capabilities to our customers. This will require engagement in every phase of the system development lifecycle including requirements generation, system and software design, implementation, integration, and flight test, with an emphasis on Python based software development. Activities will range from low TRL research, proof of concepts, development of prototypes, building demonstrators, and transition to production. The selected candidate can expect to utilize current AI paradigms including deep learning, signal processing, computer vision, reinforcement learning, to integrate these technologies into DoD customer systems, in order to solve complex problems and field innovative solutions.

Must exhibit self-motivation, a strong work ethic, time management and interpersonal skills.

There is a strong preference for the selected candidate to be based in Moorestown, NJ or Cherry Hill, NJ. This candidate could also potentially be located in Shelton, Connecticut. Candidates can expect to spend 25% or more of their time performing hands-on development of radio-frequency (RF) and digital signal processing (DSP) systems.

Must be a US Citizen.
