The Quality Performance Management Solutions Delivery team aids in shifting the Q&MS enterprise to meet our Key Results. This includes system modernization, consolidation of Business Area processes & practices and cutting edge data science and analytic tactics.

Lockheed Martin Aeronautics is seeking a full-time, partially-remote, experienced Data Scientist Manager to lead a team of Data Analyst, Data Engineers and Software Engineers that are reengineering the way Quality professionals work across the entire value stream and product lifecycle. This role will ensure the data architecture efforts for the Quality and Mission Success (Q&MS) organization will meet the needs of the organization for the long term. Employees will be geographically dispersed across our Fort Worth, TX, Marietta, GA, or Palmdale, CA locations as well as full-time teleworkers.

You will work with cross-functional stakeholders to ensure Quality processes are well-defined and efficiently implemented. Experience and/or knowledge of quality engineering principles is required. This position will strategically and tactically integrate and coordinate multiple Quality capabilities to help Aeronautics successfully meet Aero 100 goals that maximize our business needs. In this role, you will get to work closely with cross-business teams like technology transformation leads, IT professionals, change management, design/manufacturing/process engineers and Quality data analysts.

This position is for an engineer to perform the design, analysis, and requirements verification of high performance radar systems, particularly within the domain of Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning. This position requires significant experience in the design and/or integration of sensor systems such as radar systems or electronic warfare systems. Significant experience with artificial intelligence, machine learning and/or deep learning algorithms is required. Significant experience with radar performance tools such as MATLAB is required. Description:

Lockheed Martin Aeronautics. Be More Than You Can Imagine.

Lockheed Martin needs extraordinary people who are passionate about working on cutting-edge design or technology.

Exciting opportunity to work within the Simulation System Test (SST) F-35 System Integration Test (SI&T) Simulation/System Integration Labs (SIM/SIL) Verification Validation (V&V) team.

This position is for F35IAB Verification and Validation Data Engineer Sr. The F35IAB Data Engineer Sr should have an excellent background in data analytics to join the team, develop actionable metrics and models to make data-based decisions.

Focused primarily on performing Validation and Verification tests for the various capabilities and systems incorporated in the simulated F-35 model. The position involves processing data and assessing the results, as well as interfacing with the software development system engineers in the team to improve upon the existing suite of tools and the overall analytic processes.

The selected candidate will leverage thorough data analysis skills from every step of the analytics pipeline (collection, wrangling, cleaning, analysis, modeling, visualization, presentation) in order to achieve results in their projects. Tools and technologies which the candidate will use and need to be familiar with include Linux, Python, and MATLAB.

This position requires critical thinking, problem-solving skills and ability to organize large amounts of data in a presentable fashion.

Must be a US citizen. This position requires special access and a Secret clearance after starting. This position will also require unique program security clearance.

Do you enjoy developing, inspecting, mining, transforming, and modeling data to raise productivity, improve decision making, and gain competitive advantage in a production setting? Are data visualization applications your playground? If so, this is the perfect position for you!

Lockheed Martin is seeking an Operations Data Analyst for a position in Lufkin, Texas. This role is responsible for the development and maintenance of automated tools utilized to promote effective data-backed decision making and improve overall program and site effectiveness. Candidate will need a combination of business acumen, creative thinking, strong analytical and problem-solving skills as well as programming knowledge. Tasks will include, but are not limit to the following:


Lufkin Operations facility was established in 1995 and became an integral part of the Lockheed Martin family in 1997. Its approximately 300+ employees perform circuit card assembly, wire harness assembly and final assembly, integration and testing for several missile programs. Lufkin is the regional hub of East Texas, which includes 12 surrounding counties. It is best known for its vast pine tree forests that stretch for miles and the lakes and other waterways that provide great fishing and recreational activities. Local residents have an easy commute to and from Lufkin and have access to larger cities such as Dallas, Houston and Shreveport, LA. Lufkin Operations facility’s commitment to excellence makes it the premier employer in our small, East Texas community. We have a highly motivated workforce dedicated and committed to the warfighter and to supporting the community. Your mission is ours!

Relocation: Relocation assistance is possible for this exciting and challenging position. The Locale: Lufkin, Texas is a great place to live offering lots of things to do with a small town charm. The cost of living is quite reasonable in this region so you can definitely live large in Lufkin! Lufkin is at the crossroads of East Texas at the intersection of Highways US 59 which leads to Houston and the Rio Grande Valley to the south and Nacogdoches and Texarkana to the North, and US 69 which leads to the Golden Triangle of Southeast Texas, Port Arthur and Beaumont to the Southeast and to Jacksonville, Tyler, Dallas, and Oklahoma to the North.

Description:Work with stakeholders throughout the organization to identify opportunities for leveraging company data to drive business solutions.

Data Wrangling – proficiency in handling imperfections in data is an important aspect of a data scientist job description.

Title: DevOps Engineer, Staff
Job_Description:
Job ID: 593504BR
Date posted: Aug. 18, 2022

Locations: King of Prussia, Pennsylvania
Program: Space Security - Whiskey

COVID-19 continues to significantly impact our employees, families and communities. With employee health and safety as our top priority, and as a federal contractor, Lockheed Martin is taking action to address the increased risk and uncertainty COVID-19 variants pose in the workplace and ensuring we meet our commitments to national security.

To uphold safety for all employees, we will continue to request vaccination status for all Lockheed Martin employees including new hires. All current and newly hired employees are required to follow onsite safety measures based upon the COVID-19 Community Level at the specific work location.

We need skirmishers. We need engineers with scars they've gained over the course of many successes and failures. We need people that know how to get things done. We need people that know how to inspire and lead.

This job is in a new, growing, well-organized program. We incorporate many of the latest technologies and practices of industry, evaluating and adopting them as possible. Meetings over an hour are very rare and we keep work life-balance in check (because we plan to avoid heroics).

You will not be programming just another database, another website, another monolith, another MVP, another HR system, another financial system... you will be doing really cool things, that have an impact. This is not a boring, stuffy job you might expect at a large company. We use cool tech and process and we even try to make work comfortable. We just need good people like you.

Do you fear missing your foosball table, your pool table, your cool office furniture, your refrigerator of snacks, to life in a big company? Well, we don't have a pool table (foosball we do!), but we realize the impact conveniences like snacks and coffee have on employee happiness so we keep those stocked. We have windows too! All small things that make a difference.


At the dawn of a new space age, Lockheed Martin a pioneer, partner, innovator and builder. Our amazing people are on a mission to make a difference in the world and every day we use our outstanding skills and experiences to create, craft and build solutions to some of the worlds' hardest engineering problems. Our culture supports employees to dream big, perform with excellence and create incredible products. We provide the resources, encouragement and focus and if you have the passion, we want to build a better tomorrow with you!


You will serve as a software developer (DevOps-ish) looking to improve process and solve problems for a large and growing program. We triage problems (ensuring we have a good understanding of the program needs), then automate where we can and provide tools where we can't. You will be on an Agile Kanban team with surprising control of it's own priorities. The job is a mix of tools, process, people and practical solutions (ex. We used ASCII art to increase people noticing error messages and warnings). The program is centered on Kubernetes, Helm and Gitlab CI/CD with languages including Java, JavaScript and Python. We strive for quantified approaches to prioritization where possible. You will be working on a mission that you can be proud of, knowing that you are making a lasting difference in the world and in the Space domain.

The Space Security Division within Lockheed Martin Space's Mission Solutions business area is seeking a dedicated software engineer to join the team in Valley Forge, Pennsylvania.





This position requires a government security clearance, you must be a US Citizen for consideration.
TS/SCI


By applying to this job, you are expressing interest in this position and could be considered for other career opportunities where similar skills and requirements have been identified as a match. Should this match be identified you may be contacted for this and future openings.
Part-time Remote Telework: The employee selected for this position will work part of their work schedule remotely and part of their work schedule at a designated Lockheed Martin facility. The specific weekly schedule will be discussed during the hiring process.
Lockheed Martin supports a variety of alternate work schedules that provide additional flexibility to our employees. Schedules range from standard 40 hours over a five day work week while others may be condensed. These condensed schedules provide employees with additional time away from the office and are in addition to our Paid Time off benefits.

Description:Here at Lockheed Martin's Rotary and Mission Systems (RMS) business in Moorestown, NJ we are responsible for integrating, testing, and demonstrating some of our customers most complex systems. As an engineer in our System Integration and Test (SI&T) department, you will be a part of the team responsible for high level system design, system test planning and test execution for our key customers, including US Navy, US Coast Guard, US Missile Defense Agency, US Air Force, and international customers.

This Full Stack Engineer role is within the Tools, Technology, and Process Group - which has responsibility for data analytics, test automation, and transformative technology adoption within the System Integration and Test (SI&T) department. The successful candidate will be responsible for developing, modifying, testing, deploying, and maintaining the Test Automation Framework (TAF) utilized in automated System-Level testing, and the System Test Pipeline (STP) infrastructure (scheduler, executor, and data pipeline) which enables it.

We are looking for an innovative thinker who will help to accelerate Lockheed Martin’s RMS operations by leveraging application development technologies to transform existing processes into automated systems. The successful candidate enjoys challenges, can work independently, and can learn new technologies quickly – your growth will be sponsored and championed within this organization.

Description:Here at Lockheed Martin's RMS business area in Moorestown, NJ, we are working on many exciting defense programs and developing cutting edge products and applications to meet the complex and evolving needs of our customers. Major programs we are developing include Space Fence, Long Range Discrimination Radar (LRDR), Aegis, Littoral Combat System (LCS) along with many others. A major portion of our work includes writing robust software and firmware applications and doing some very impressive modeling and simulations for these exciting and mission critical programs. We have a number of new positions to fill in support of our efforts.

Click here to learn more about RMS.https://www.lockheedmartin.com/en-us/who-we-are/business-areas/rotary-and-mission-systems.html

We are seeking a DevSecOps Engineer with systems and/or software engineering experience responsible for design, implementation, integration, and verification activities of a software product.

The DevSecOps Engineer will execute systems and software engineering processes starting from high level system requirements, product requirements allocation, and product software design through software implementation, integration and verification.

Knowledge of systems and/or software engineering process desired. Knowledge of Linux operating system is desired.

Experience with the Java programming language, algorithm and software development is preferred. Experience with software testing is preferred.

Specific Duties:
The engineer will 1) Develop system and product requirements using SysML diagrams and DOORS requirements repositories. 2) Implement software changes using modern development tools 3) Integrate software application within a larger system environment 4) Verify product requirements. 5) Delivery to the customer
The product development and deployment process will follow the DevSecOps workflow and Agile methodology. Our readiness products are deployed to programs across Naval Combat & Missile Defense Systems to multiple DoD customers




Familiarity with database technologies such as Oracle, SQLServer, MySQL, Sybase or Firebird would be a plus.

Familiarity with Agile Product Development

Familiarity with Linux and/or Windows

An interest in learning more about any of the following specific areas would be appreciated: J2EE Development, XML, Service Oriented Architectures, Microservices, WEB Services, REST Services, automated test frameworks, DevSecOps technologies, distributed computer architectures and Web-based architectures.

Description:Here at Lockheed Martin's RMS business area in Moorestown, NJ, we are working on many exciting defense programs and developing cutting edge products and applications to meet the complex and evolving needs of our customers. Major programs we are developing include Space Fence, Long Range Discrimination Radar (LRDR), Aegis, Littoral Combat System (LCS) along with many others. A major portion of our work includes writing robust software and firmware applications and doing some very impressive modeling and simulations for these exciting and mission critical programs. We have a number of new positions to fill in support of our efforts.

Click here to learn more about RMS.https://www.lockheedmartin.com/en-us/who-we-are/business-areas/rotary-and-mission-systems.html

We are seeking a DevSecOps Engineer with systems and/or software engineering experience responsible for design, implementation, integration, and verification activities of a software product.

The DevSecOps Engineer will execute systems and software engineering processes starting from high level system requirements, product requirements allocation, and product software design through software implementation, integration and verification.

Knowledge of systems and/or software engineering process desired. Knowledge of Linux operating system is desired.

Experience with the Java programming language, algorithm and software development is preferred. Experience with software testing is preferred.

Specific Duties:
The engineer will 1) Develop system and product requirements using SysML diagrams and DOORS requirements repositories. 2) Implement software changes using modern development tools 3) Integrate software application within a larger system environment 4) Verify product requirements. 5) Delivery to the customer
The product development and deployment process will follow the DevSecOps workflow and Agile methodology. Our readiness products are deployed to programs across Naval Combat & Missile Defense Systems to multiple DoD customers




Familiarity with database technologies such as Oracle, SQLServer, MySQL, Sybase or Firebird would be a plus.

Familiarity with Agile Product Development

Familiarity with Linux and/or Windows

An interest in learning more about any of the following specific areas would be appreciated: J2EE Development, XML, Service Oriented Architectures, Microservices, WEB Services, REST Services, automated test frameworks, DevSecOps technologies, distributed computer architectures and Web-based architectures.

From designing the most advanced air vehicle to designing aircraft that defies gravity, our engineers live on the cutting edge of technology. As a Dev Sec Ops Engineer, you are an integral part of the F-35 Common Reprogramming Tool (CRT) team. The F-35 CRT is a very large software application that is in the early stages of development. It will be used by our F-35 customer Reprogramming Labs to generate the Mission Data File (MDF) sets which are pivotal to implementation of effective missions and overall operation of the F-35 aircraft. After completion of the initial CRT delivery, development will continue with enhancements for complex follow through and data analysis that will continue to enable the leading edge technology that supports our customers' future needs.

A great candidate would enjoy learning new technologies, developing subject matter expertise, and working with collaborative Agile teams to create innovative experiences. This is a great opportunity to get in on the ground floor of a new product, performing software development in a DevOps environment to build the modernized CRT application and expand on its capabilities to enable future technologies.

The candidate will help mature CRT's DevSecOps implementation and have a strong desire to automate processes rather than doing them twice. The candidate will leverage the latest DevSecOps tools and methodologies to deliver value to our customers quickly, efficiently, and repeatedly.

The Candidate will be responsible for developing software in support of some of the most cutting-edge efforts in the world and participate in establishing an updated software development environment. You will have the opportunity to be a part of a high-performing team.


***Must be a US Citizen. This position is located at a facility that requires special access and a Secret clearance*** (Don’t worry, we will walk you through the process)

Description:WHO WE ARE
At Lockheed Martin Aeronautics, we're taking engineering creativity to the next level. From designing the most advanced air vehicle to designing aircraft that defy gravity, our engineers live on the cutting edge of technology. Never have the opportunities for a technical career been so limitless.
Our team is responsible for developing complex systems and platforms across many exciting domains. With that in mind, we value, innovation, creative thinking, self-motivation, and leading by example. Care to join us?

In this highly versatile role as a DevOps Engineer on our team, you will use your multitasking skills to balance everything from computer coding, testing, and deployment to figure out creative ways to integrate or replace legacy embedded systems processes with modern resources and workflows.
This career offers unique exposure, with the chance to get involved on the ground floor of exciting new programs, designing and developing new software and hardware components to be integrated into the future F-35, F-16, and our Skunk Works mission systems.
With exciting growth expected, we welcome the opportunity to play a part in your professional success story.
This position is in Louisville, Colorado. Located near the front range of the Rocky Mountains, Louisville, a suburb of Denver, is known for its 300 days of sunshine, thriving cultural scene, and natural beauty. The area offers nearly endless opportunities for nearby snow skiing, hiking, and nature viewing.
Learn more about our perks and benefits here at Lockheed Martin: Https://Www.Lockheedmartinjobs.Com/Working-Here#Benefits


On our team of skilled Embedded Systems, Software, and FPGA engineers, you will have exposure to a variety of products and platforms and will have the unique opportunity to make a positive impact in the lives of many by developing state-of-the-art embedded systems. You can thrive on our team by fostering positive working relationships with all stakeholders, from software engineering, test engineering, and IT to automate and deploy, build, and test the products and systems.
Beyond that, you may also find yourself:

Description:What You Really Want to Know:
We need skirmishers. We need engineers with scars they’ve gained over the course of many successes and failures. We need people that know how to get things done. We need people that know how to inspire and lead.

This job is in a new, growing, well-organized program. We incorporate many of the latest technologies and practices of industry, evaluating and adopting them as possible. Meetings over an hour are very rare and we keep work life-balance in check (because we plan to avoid heroics).

You will not be programming just another database, another website, another monolith, another MVP, another HR system, another financial system… you will be doing really cool things, that have an impact. This is not a boring, stuffy job you might expect at a large company. We use cool tech and process and we even try to make work comfortable. We just need good people like you.

Do you fear missing your foosball table, your pool table, your cool office furniture, your refrigerator of snacks, to life in a big company? Well, we don’t have a pool table (foosball we do!), but we realize the impact conveniences like snacks and coffee have on employee happiness so we keep those stocked. We have windows too! All small things that make a difference.


At the dawn of a new space age, Lockheed Martin a pioneer, partner, innovator and builder. Our amazing people are on a mission to make a difference in the world and every day we use our outstanding skills and experiences to create, craft and build solutions to some of the worlds’ hardest engineering problems. Our culture supports employees to dream big, perform with excellence and create incredible products. We provide the resources, encouragement and focus and if you have the passion, we want to build a better tomorrow with you!


You will serve as a software developer (DevOps-ish) looking to improve process and solve problems for a large and growing program. We triage problems (ensuring we have a good understanding of the program needs), then automate where we can and provide tools where we can’t. You will be on an Agile Kanban team with surprising control of it’s own priorities. The job is a mix of tools, process, people and practical solutions (ex. We used ASCII art to increase people noticing error messages and warnings). The program is centered on Kubernetes, Helm and Gitlab CI/CD with languages including Java, JavaScript and Python. We strive for quantified approaches to prioritization where possible. You will be working on a mission that you can be proud of, knowing that you are making a lasting difference in the world and in the Space domain.

The Space Security Division within Lockheed Martin Space’s Mission Solutions business area is seeking a dedicated software engineer to join the team in Valley Forge, Pennsylvania.

his position is in our Colorado Springs, Colorado location. Day Shift, flexible, 9x80 (Every other Friday off) schedule, and the ability to occasionally work from home.

Join the Mission Planner DevSecOps Engineering team of Lockheed Martin Rotary and Mission Systems. Use your technical acuity and grow into a leader in system and/or software engineering

The System Engineer in this position will work across several Aegis programs with responsibilities in Ballistic Missile Defense (BMD) and Integrated Air Missile Defense (IAMD) tasking for Mission Planner.

The engineer will have responsibility for algorithmic design, data analysis, requirements development, modeling and simulation, and software integration and test. This will entail developing solutions to mathematical and physics-based problems. The successful candidate will be responsible for ensuring the logical and systematic conversion of customer or product requirements into a total system solution that acknowledges technical, schedule, and cost constraints. This includes interfacing with the customer in performing test & evaluation activities, and with internal software teams to isolate and fix issues.

In addition, the successful candidate will be given opportunity to work software engineering tasks in a DevSecOps environment. Tasking may include responsibility for developing software using Java and/or C++, software testing and debugging, requirements gathering, applications development, GUI development, scientific applications development and modeling & simulations development.

We offer flexible work schedules, a continuous learning environment with strong career growth and advancement opportunities.

Sensor Tradecraft Optimization (STO) enables our organization to align with CSD priorities. STO is an end-to-end agnostic solution provider that analyzes sensor data, designs, and delivers automated solutions to optimize sensor collection. STO architects and engineer’s tradecraft threads to drive sensors to produce the highest value data and threat intelligences to improve the Nation’s cybersecurity posture.

TKO requires Software engineers to support the Cyber Threat Intelligence initiative to support defense of our nation’s most critical unclassified and classified networks. The program is seeking a DevOps engineer to provide integration support. The ideal candidate will have the following:

Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or related discipline plus Twenty (20) years’ experience as a SWE in programs and contracts of similar scope, type, and complexity

Description:The coolest jobs on this planet… or any other… are with Lockheed Martin Space.

Do you want to be part of a culture that inspires employees to envision the impossible, perform with excellence and build incredible products? We provide the resources, inspiration, and focus—if you have the passion and courage to dream big, then we want to build a better tomorrow with you.

We are currently seeking an experienced DevSecOps Engineer to maintain network security in support of the Next Generation GEO Overhead Persistent Infrared (NGG OPIR) consolidated factory.

The DevSecOps engineer will be responsible for providing leadership in the areas of vulnerability scanning, certificate management, password policy management, data analysis of security monitoring outputs, coordination of remediation patching, and other daily security and compliance efforts. The DevSecOps will work with team members to develop an automated security framework for deployment of tools and processes, leveraging various scripting languages and open source solutions.

Apply today if you are ready to explore new opportunities and connect with a Lockheed recruiter who is excited to speak with you!

We care about our employees and offer a generous benefits package: 401K, PTO, work/life balance, and more.

The Systems Engineer will be responsible for analysis, design, integration, and test. Tasking will include development of mission critical software & hardware requirements. The candidate will be responsible for development of requirements using SysML diagrams and constructs. The candidate will be responsible for completion of systems engineering related tasks to meet cost and schedule. Knowledge of system engineering process desired. Performs requirements development, verification and validation, cost and risk, supportability and effectiveness analyses for total systems. Perform data analysis and code inspection in , , and/or to troubleshoot product and system level issues. Work in a team environment on one or more of the following areas: analysis, requirements development, design, modeling, simulation, integration, test. Supporting the various testing groups, waterfront installation and testing in-port or at-sea. Domestic and International travel may be required.

Title: DevOps Engineer, Staff
Job_Description:
COVID-19 continues to significantly impact our employees, families and communities. With employee health and safety as our top priority, and as a federal contractor, Lockheed Martin is taking action to address the increased risk and uncertainty COVID-19 variants pose in the workplace and ensuring we meet our commitments to national security.

Description:Lockheed Martin is a global security and aerospace company that employs approximately 114,000 people worldwide and is principally engaged in the research, design, development, manufacture, integration and sustainment of advanced technology systems, products and services. Lockheed Martin Missiles and Fire Control (MFC) is one of four Lockheed Martin business areas. MFC is a recognized designer, developer and manufacturer of precision engagement aerospace and defense systems for the U.S. and allied militaries. MFC develops, manufactures and supports advanced products for military customers that include the U.S. Army, Navy, Air Force, Marine Corps, NASA and dozens of foreign allies. MFC also offers a wide range of products and services for the global civil nuclear power industry and the military’s green power initiatives.

MFC is looking for an experienced Software Engineer to develop continuous integration and continuous delivery (CI/CD) pipelines for a variety of product development teams using Development / Security / Operations (DevSecOps) methodologies and tools. Ideally the candidate will have a background that includes embedded C++ development as most of the pipelines will process C++ code for embedded systems. As the candidate matures, they will assist the product development teams in refining and customizing the pipelines for optimal use in secure environments. The best candidate will be well versed in CI/CD tools and security techniques. For this first assignment, the candidate will work in a team with both technical and career leaders.

Candidates applying to this position should have a Bachelor’s degree, or greater, in Computer Engineering, Software Engineering, Computer Science or an equivalent field with significant software development experience.

It is possible that travel will be required to both customer and supplier sites. It is possible that travel will be both within and outside the Continental United States (CONUS).

Telecommuting opportunities can vary depending on daily tasking. For more details about the classification of this assignment, please see "Ability to Work Remotely".

Candidates filling this position will need a US citizen and will need a clearance at the level specified in “Clearance Level” or will need the ability to get a clearance if not specified. In addition to meeting security clearance requirements, candidate may need to be approved to work Special Access Program (SAP) prior to start of employment."

C++ 11 or later
DevSecOps methodologies and technologies
Continuous Delivery and Continuous Deployment (CI/CD) software development pipelines - implementing & configuring

Agile software development methodologies
Ansible (Red Hat) - automate apps and IT infrastructure. Application Deployment + Configuration Management + Continuous Delivery.
Docker – Container Runtimes
Git - source code versioning
GitLab (Atlassian) - source code versioning cloud service a lot like GitHub with private and public versions
GitLab Continuous Integration (CI) - service is a part of GitLab that build and test the software whenever developer pushes code to application
Jenkins (Sun Microsystems) - an open source automation server which enables developers around the world to reliably build, test, and deploy their software.
Jira - issue tracker with requirements management and Agile project management features
JSON - open standard file format and data interchange format
Kubernetes - container management
Linux - operating system with many distributions, based on Unix
Multi-threaded software development
Nexus (Google) - repository manager for managing JARs
Python - scripting language
Terraform – virtual machine deployment
Windows OS
YAML - data serialization language that is used for writing configuration files

Description:When it comes to using cutting-edge machine learning to tackle complex problems, Lockheed Martin is driven by a singular mission focus and desire to continuously innovate. Today’s challenges to global security aren’t just changing – they’re accelerating faster than ever before. Through our dedication to our mission, our AI-enabled systems are changing the way militaries operate and protect their forces, the way first responders fight fires, and how researchers explore the far reaches of space and the ocean’s depths.

Data Analytics Innovations (DAI) is currently hiring a Data Engineer to work a 100% remote position. DAI is focused on harnessing the power of data, analytics, and software to solve the world’s toughest problems. DAI is rapidly delivering tangible, differentiated, and meaningful software in both the defense and commercial domains. You would be joining a team with diverse backgrounds who are at the forefront of developing talent, technology, and strategy in these rapidly-advancing fields. The team is leading many initiatives to evolve both Lockheed Martin and customer cultures to embrace game changing capabilities, accelerated computing, and data-driven decision making. Our rapidly evolving development team functions like a small startup within Lockheed Martin Rotary and Mission Systems, rapidly developing software in pursuit of these objectives, and working with a wide variety of internal customer and expert groups.

The Data Engineer delivers full-stack data solutions across the entire data processing pipeline. This relies on systems engineering principles to design and implement solutions that span the data lifecycle to: collect, ingest, process, store, persist, access, and deliver data at scale and at speed. It includes knowledge of local, distributed, and cloud-based technologies; data virtualization and smart caching; and all security and authentication mechanisms required to protect the data.

Description:Are you looking for an exciting career as a Hardware Engineer at one of the top Aerospace and Defense Companies? A fulfilling position that challenges your mind, grows your skills, and contributes to our Nation’s most critical missions is right in front of you! At Lockheed Martin Space, we advance the frontiers of science, help the military protect what matters most, and solve problems that others think are impossible. We have challenging missions that will inspire and innovate!

The Real-time Transfer Service (RTS) team is growing, and we are looking for Hardware Engineers who like to solve problems, be a part of a high performing team, get into the guts of the system, and take on all challenges. The RTS program has a consistent pipeline of work and a variety of technical opportunities and challenges. We offer a flexible work environment, flexible schedule, and off Fridays. We are seeking Hardware Engineers that love to solve problems, value a commitment to hard work, enjoy peeling back the layers of a capability and understanding how it works and interacts with other aspects of the system. We are looking for someone who enjoys working with enthusiastic & motivated teammates and getting stuff done! We have high standards and expectations for our team.

This position is in beautiful Boulder, Colorado location which has numerous amenities such as a fitness center, daily rotating food trucks, and a collaborative and modern agile workspace.

This position is for a data engineer to support Common Data Model, a key Data Strategy capability within the office of the Lockheed Martin Chief Data and Analytics Officer (CDAO).

The Common Data Model creates a canonical data model for use as a common, standardized format for business application and business process integration within and between Lockheed Martin Business Areas and between Lockheed Martin and external partners and suppliers.

Description:
Lockheed Martin Aeronautics. Be More Than You Can Imagine.

Our products play an important role in the national security of the United States and more than 70 other countries, ensuring peace and stability around the world. Highly trained and specialized personnel and facilities are key to the company's unrivaled success in the aeronautics industry. Our workforce of more than 25,000 has pre-eminent expertise in advanced aircraft design and production, modification and support, stealth technology and systems integration.

Lockheed Martin Aeronautics is seeking a Flight Test Data Processing Engineer. In this role, you will design, build, integrate, and operate systems for the real-time display of aircraft data as well as post-test processing of recorded data to create data products.

You will assist with diagnosing and resolving problems that arise from the collection and processing of data. You will actively work to expand your knowledge of the discipline and of specific tasking.

You must be willing to work extended hours, weekends, and rotations in support of mission goals.

**Must be a US Citizen. This position is located at a facility that requires special access.**

Description:Define the future of aviation. Stand at the forefront of technology and innovation. Transform your ideas and dreams into reality. Join Lockheed Martin’s Flight Controls and Autonomy team and be part of the greatest transformation in aviation history; fully autonomous flight.

The Flight Controls and Autonomy team is currently seeking highly motivated technology pioneers with a desire to steer and lead the Autonomy industry. Successful candidates must be willing and able to work on highly complex challenging problems, leading to world-changing technological breakthroughs.

Team’s technical areas of emphasis include Fly-By-Wire Flight Control Systems, Guidance/Navigation & Control (GNC), Flight Test, Autonomy, Aviation Robotics, Perception, AI and Motion Planning.

The Flight Controls Data Analyst will work closely with the team’s functional management to streamline data collection and generation across the many programs under our oversight. Through the use of various scripting languages and tools, the data analyst will enable automation for software metrics, verification and validation metrics, process optimization, hiring activities, and other internal data collection activities. The primary focus is on reducing cost while utilizing cutting-edge technologies and software development principles to optimize our business practices.

Description:Are you a data junkie? Do you enjoy developing, inspecting, mining, transforming, and modeling data to raise productivity, improve decision making, and gain competitive advantage in a production setting? Are data visualization applications your playground? If so, this is the perfect position for you!

Lockheed Martin is seeking an Operations Data Analyst for a position in Lufkin, Texas. This role is responsible for the development and maintenance of automated tools utilized to promote effective data-backed decision making and improve overall program and site effectiveness. Candidate will need a combination of business acumen, creative thinking, strong analytical and problem-solving skills as well as programming knowledge. Tasks will include, but are not limit to the following:


Lufkin Operations facility was established in 1995 and became an integral part of the Lockheed Martin family in 1997. Its approximately 300+ employees perform circuit card assembly, wire harness assembly and final assembly, integration and testing for several missile programs. Lufkin is the regional hub of East Texas, which includes 12 surrounding counties. It is best known for its vast pine tree forests that stretch for miles and the lakes and other waterways that provide great fishing and recreational activities. Local residents have an easy commute to and from Lufkin and have access to larger cities such as Dallas, Houston and Shreveport, LA. Lufkin Operations facility’s commitment to excellence makes it the premier employer in our small, East Texas community. We have a highly motivated workforce dedicated and committed to the warfighter and to supporting the community. Your mission is ours!

Relocation: Relocation assistance is possible for this exciting and challenging position. The Locale: Lufkin, Texas is a great place to live offering lots of things to do with a small town charm. The cost of living is quite reasonable in this region so you can definitely live large in Lufkin! Lufkin is at the crossroads of East Texas at the intersection of Highways US 59 which leads to Houston and the Rio Grande Valley to the south and Nacogdoches and Texarkana to the North, and US 69 which leads to the Golden Triangle of Southeast Texas, Port Arthur and Beaumont to the Southeast and to Jacksonville, Tyler, Dallas, and Oklahoma to the North.

With our employees as our priority, we provide diverse career opportunities designed to propel development and boost agility. Our flexible schedules, competitive pay, and comprehensive benefits enable our employees to live a healthy, fulfilling life at and outside of work.
At Lockheed Martin, we place an emphasis on empowering our employees by fostering innovation, integrity, and exemplifying the epitome of corporate responsibility.
Your Mission is Ours.

The Overhead Persistent Infrared (OPIR) domain within Lockheed Martin Space is designing, building, and integrating the current and future generation of space systems that creatively combines satellite technology, sophisticated sensors, and data processing to provide crucial global infrared data 24/7. This mission advises Presidential decisions and defends the US and its allies in a rapidly evolving environment. Help us advance our OPIR designs and deliver survivable satellites with nuclear-hardened electronics, sophisticated communications, resiliency and cyber security. OPIR is a mission area where you can make big things happen and solve some of the country’s hardest problems. Come join a team that has a vision for the future of space and knows what it takes to get there.

Lockheed Martin Space is looking for an ambitious Early Career Engineer / Configuration Analyst to join the OPIR team in Sunnyvale, CA. This exciting role supports Configuration & Data Management (CDM) team within the Systems Engineering Integration & Test (SEIT) segment of OPIR.

determine effect on overall product and system

Description:

Lockheed Martin Aeronautics. Be More Than You Can Imagine.

Lockheed Martin needs extraordinary people who are passionate about working on cutting-edge design or technology.

Exciting opportunity to work within the Simulation System Test (SST) F-35 System Integration Test (SI&T) Simulation/System Integration Labs (SIM/SIL) Verification Validation (V&V) team.

This position is for F35IAB Verification and Validation Data Engineer Sr. The F35IAB Data Engineer Sr should have an excellent background in data analytics to join the team, develop actionable metrics and models to make data-based decisions.

Focused primarily on performing Validation and Verification tests for the various capabilities and systems incorporated in the simulated F-35 model. The position involves processing data and assessing the results, as well as interfacing with the software development system engineers in the team to improve upon the existing suite of tools and the overall analytic processes.

The selected candidate will leverage thorough data analysis skills from every step of the analytics pipeline (collection, wrangling, cleaning, analysis, modeling, visualization, presentation) in order to achieve results in their projects. Tools and technologies which the candidate will use and need to be familiar with include Linux, Python, and MATLAB.

This position requires critical thinking, problem-solving skills and ability to organize large amounts of data in a presentable fashion.

Must be a US citizen. This position requires special access and a Secret clearance after starting. This position will also require unique program security clearance.

Description:Lockheed Martin is seeking a Configuration Data Management (CDM) Analyst for a position in Grand Prairie, TX to perform the duties necessary to analyze proposed changes of product design and determine effect on overall product and system.
Typical duties include providing services and coordinating the following activities:
Participation as an active member in any Integrated Product/Process Team (IPT).
Participation in review of all Contracts, which includes providing comments regarding the content in the Terms & Conditions, Statement of Work, Contract Data Requirements List, and Document Summary List, as well as verification of comment incorporation.
Preparing, publishing, and revising the contractor’s Configuration Management Plan (CMP). Ensure Configuration Control activities are implemented on the program. Configuration Control Board (CCB) meetings are conducted on the program.
Protect and maintain the government and contractor controlled technical data package (TDP).
Development, preparation, and change control of the contractor change controlled and Government change controlled TDP.
All Government changes (RFDs and ECPs) are approved and contract modified prior to the delivery of hardware.
Review and provide comments for Engineering Releases and verify that all comments have been incorporated correctly.
Monitor all release activity after CCB approval, release, and distribution processing to ensure error-free final completion of effort. Coordinate resolution for errors/omissions with appropriate area of responsibility.
Generate Engineering Releases in PDM to process documents (specifications, Engineering Release Records, etc.).
Create unique CD's and electronic uploads for deliveries, as required. Prepare record releases of subcontractor/supplier data.
Configuration Status Accounting (CSA) activities are met. CSA records are current.
Software Configuration Management (SCM) requirements are being met.
Conduct audits to ensure appropriate CM procedures are implemented: Functional Configuration Audits (FCA), Physical Configuration Audits (PCA), and audits of subcontractor/vendor TDPs and CM/DM Systems.
Ensure Serialization and Traceability requirements are met.
Review and release of the subcontractor/vendor Statement of Requirements (SOR).
Leading and mentoring program CM/DM team members.
Maintain an accurate As-Designed configuration within the PLM database for all end item deliverables.
Maintain program access control for CM systems/tools.
Maintain Document Number Assignment Logs.
Prepare and update work instructions as required.
Ensure Data Management activities are implemented. CDRLs/SDRLs and status and reporting requirements are met.
Prepare request for DD250 and transmittal of non-electronic data for customer and subcontractor deliverables.

MFCE&T

Must have or be able to obtain a Secret clearance
Strong interpersonal skills and an ability to build effective working relationships are a must Candidate must have excellent oral and written communication skills, technical writing experience, and an ability to perform oral presentations in front of large groups
Must be able to work well in a team environment and work well with various levels of management
Strong attention to detail and must be able to work with minimal supervision
Proficient with and comprehensive knowledge of Microsoft Office and a basic understanding of Contracts
Candidate must be willing to work over-time and travel as needed to support program requirements

Configuration management experience in a Department of Defense and/or Commercial Configuration / Data Management Certificate Knowledge of EIA-649, National Consensus Standard for Configuration Management Experience implementing and conducting a Configuration Management program per MIL-HDBK-61 (A(, Configuration Management Guidance
Experience with Product Data Management tools Ability to quickly learn new software tools and processes
Experience with electronic data vaulting and digital data handling and in-depth understanding of the American Society of Mechanical Engineers (ASME) and American National Standards Institute (ANSI) Y14 drafting, drawing and documentation standards Strong technical background
Bachelors degree from an accredited college in a related discipline, or equivalent
experience/combined education. Entry level.

Description:This position is for the Chelmsford Production Operations Data Analyst. The selected candidate will leverage strong data analysis skills to provide key insights to manufacturing teams, support, and leadership to track and drive overall performance.

The ideal candidate is someone who can:

Create and maintain interactive data analytics dashboards to measure and improve operations performance
Collect, analyze, and summarize data to communicate insightful information to key stakeholders
Work closely with leadership team, IT team, and other key stakeholders
Present thorough and detailed reports to identify areas of opportunity to drive future decision making
Perform data validation and maintain integrity of dashboards and databases
Maintain and optimize current Tableau dashboards
Develop and automate data pipelines
Complete Ad-hoc research request from senior leadership.

Relocation: Relocation assistance is possible for this exciting position.

The Locale: Chelmsford is a charming suburb of Boston located about 25 miles northwest of that city. Chelmsford is very close to historic Lowell Massachusetts and to Nashua, New Hampshire. Chelmsford is within reach of New Hampshire’s White Mountains and awesome ski areas to the north, and the scenic coastal towns of MA and NH are about an hour east. This scenic colonial region offers lots of New England charm, great schools, shopping, and restaurants. Where can you get to from Chelmsford? Chelmsford is about 90 minutes from Cape Cod. Boston is about 30 minutes to the east without traffic. New York City is about 4.5 hours away from Chelmsford. Waterville Valley and other major ski resorts of New Hampshire and Vermont are about 2 to 3 hours to the north.
It should be noted that Chelmsford, Massachusetts is approximately 35 miles northwest of the Boston metropolitan area and offers better access to a wide range of substantially more affordable regions in the area to live. Those regions include Northeastern and North Central Massachusetts, and Southern, New Hampshire.

Bachelor’s degree and at least 2 years of experience
Experience in Manufacturing, or Business Intelligence (BI) / Data Warehousing (DW) industry
Interest in machine learning or Natural Language Processing
Perform specialized data investigations to support analytics and custom reporting scenarios
Able to focus on results
Ability to interact and communicate effectively with colleagues on requirements
Ability to work independently as well as with a team
Energetic and a self-starter
Ability to obtain a secret security clearance and must be able to obtain an interim secret clearance prior to start.

Description:The coolest jobs on this planet… or any other… are with Lockheed Martin Space.

At the dawn of a new space age, Lockheed Martin is a pioneer, partner, innovator and builder. Our amazing people are on a mission to make a difference in the world and every single day we use our skills and experiences to create, design and build solutions to some of the worlds’ hardest engineering problems. Our culture encourages employees to dream big, perform with excellence and create incredible products. We provide the resources, inspiration and focus and if you have the passion and courage to dream big, we want to build a better tomorrow with you.

The Predictive Analytics and Cost Engineering (PACE) team is a data science team that combines technical engineering data and financial data to create early cost estimates for proposals and affordability analyses of both architecture studies and program execution. The team also collects cost data and normalizes it to a standard work breakdown to both record internally and report externally. This team works closely with Engineering and Technology (E&T), Finance and Business Operations (F&BO), Strategy and Business Development (S&BD), Program/Proposal Management and Leads, and external customers.

The role is to lead a team within the larger PACE team to normalize Ground and other Mission Solutions data and then to use that data to fulfill cost engineering functions for the Mission Solutions Line of Business (LOB). This is a new position to expand PACE into a new area. It will include understanding and leveraging technical data around Software Engineering efforts to derive realistic cost estimates.

The role may also include working on affordability analysis, life cycle cost developments, cost data analytics, forecasting cost and schedule, to analyze multiple data sets build engineering models, synthesize results, perform decision analysis, and design to cost. The candidate selected will be asked to collect both technical and cost data, normalize and aggregate data, determine relationships from the data, and communicate findings with engineering colleagues and internal decision makers.

Description:Do you thrive at the intersection of business and technology? Do you have a passion for driving impact and value through data, and a desire to help others achieve those goals? The Lockheed Martin Chief Data and Analytics Office is seeking business-savvy system architects to support business transformation. This position is for a senior level Information Architect within the Lockheed Martin Chief Data and Analytics Office (CDAO). The successful candidate will report to the Customer Engagement and Solutions Senior Manager, take direction from the Chief Data Architect, and work alongside CDAO VS team leads. The successful candidate will operate at the intersection of systems architecture, business process architecture, data and analytics architecture and stakeholder and customer success to ensure the LM data strategy enables the LM business transformation strategy.

Responsibilities include but are not limited to:
 Support data and analytics architecture decomposition assessments and design decisions for the Lockheed Martin business transformation program, focusing on various value streams related primarily supply chain but to possibly include Engineering, Manufacturing, and finance. 
Contribute to the creation of an enterprise information architecture that will support the Procure to Pay value stream and associated solution design. 
Define and drive enterprise-level data architecture and analytics standards and requirements to support business process and system transformations in areas such as Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP).
 Coordinate with data architects to define and develop enterprise-wide data domains, enable data domain stewards, and consult across the enterprise on federated data architecture solutions. 
Apply systems engineering and project management disciplines to data strategy implementation and operations 
Coordinate with data team members to support data strategy implementation activities such as data governance, data management, metadata management, data security, data quality, and data interoperability.
 Work to engage and develop productive relationships with, business transformation partners and stakeholders (to understand their strategic goals) and CDAO product owners (to communicate business needs and help develop requirements).
 Develop outcome driven roadmaps that articulate CDAO strategy to achieve stakeholder (value stream, functional customer) outcomes

THIS POSITION CAN BE WORKED FROM ANY LM LOCATION OR CAN BE FULL TIME TELECOMMUTING

 Proven data architect experience with Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP). 
Functional knowledge of supply chain and finance business processes.
 Systems engineering and systems architecture experience. 
Proven experience with business process architecture and business process transformation. 
Experience harmonizing systems, processes, and/or data across multiple business areas and functions.
 Experience building and communicating technical and functional roadmaps.
 Experience with data governance standards and practices.
 Experience with Project Management and/or project coordination with cross functional teams and stakeholders - following an agile methodology and outcome-driven approach.

 Proven experience with defining and implementing data and information architecture in an SAP environment, especially SAP S/4HANA
 Proven data architecture experience with supply chain digital threads. 
Supplier integration and middleware expertise
 Experience with Cameo Systems Modeler Systems Modeling Language (SysML) / Signavio Business Process Modeling. 
Expertise with Supply Chain applications like Ariba, Exostar, and Kinaxis
 Experience with Master Data Management (MDM) techniques and platforms. 
Experience with Extract, Transfer, and Load (ETL) and Data Engineering.
 Experience with SAP data tools/platforms such as Master Data Governance (MDG), Information Steward, HANA, Data Services, etc. 
Experience with data catalog and business glossary platforms. 
Experience developing and utilizing functional ontologies and experience with ontology tools.
 Experience with System of Systems (SoS) architecture.
 Proven experience building and communicating technical and functional roadmaps.
 Proven stakeholder engagement experience.
